translated: A treatise is stated with words that are capable of revealing a special meaning.üîΩIt is not that it is dedicated to revealing just the subject matter.

original: sgra tsam don ston pa'i nus pas ston pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam don ston pa'i nus pas ston pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that it reveals by the power of the mere words.

original: de lta bas na brjod par bya ba la sogs par gtogs pa'i dgos pa ni bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod par bya ba la sogs par gtogs pa'i dgos pa ni bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the purpose belonging to the subject matter and so on is not to be stated.

original: gang yang slob dpon gyis yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na zhes gang bstan pa de ni dgos pa bstan pa yin gyi ba rjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang slob dpon gyis yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na zhes gang bstan pa de ni dgos pa bstan pa yin gyi ba rjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, when the master states, ‚ÄúBecause correct knowledge is the forerunner of the accomplishment of all the aims of man,‚Äù he is stating the purpose of the treatise, not the purpose of the subject matter.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa rtogs pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa'i sgrar brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa rtogs pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa'i sgrar brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the realization of right knowledge that is intended to be called right knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is preceded by the realization of right knowledge.

original: de lta yin dang de bstan to //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de bstan to //
translated: If that is so, then it is taught.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni dgos pa brjod pa'i don du 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni dgos pa brjod pa'i don du 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the connection in the sense of stating the purpose.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be meaningless.

original: bstan bcos kyi dgos pa de yang rnam pa gsum @139b te ;
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi dgos pa de yang rnam pa gsum @139b te ;
translated: Moreover, that purpose of the treatise is threefold:

original: bya ba'i ngo bo dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i ngo bo dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the nature of what is to be done, the result of what is to be done, and the result of the result of what is to be done.

original: 'di ltar pha rol rtogs par bya ba'i don du brtsams pa'i bstan bcos ni byed pa nyid dam byed pa po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol rtogs par bya ba'i don du brtsams pa'i bstan bcos ni byed pa nyid dam byed pa po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, a treatise composed for the purpose of understanding the other is itself the agent or the instrument.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa dag kyang sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i dgos pa las ma gtogs pa'i dgos pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa dag kyang sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i dgos pa las ma gtogs pa'i dgos pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And since the agent and action are also the means of accomplishing, there is no purpose other than the purpose stated.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni bya ba la ltos ba'i phyir dang / bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum po de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir de dgos pa nyid du rigs la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni bya ba la ltos ba'i phyir dang / bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum po de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir de dgos pa nyid du rigs la /
translated: Since the means of accomplishing depends on the action, and since the three, the action, etc., are not possible without it, it is reasonable that it is the purpose.

original: dngos dang brgyud pas byas pa'i khyad par ni yod do //
analyzed: dngos dang brgyud pas byas pa'i khyad par ni yod do //
translated: But there is a difference between the direct and indirect.

original: bya ba rtsom pa ni de'i don du yin pa'i phyir dgos pa ni 'bras bu de'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rtsom pa ni de'i don du yin pa'i phyir dgos pa ni 'bras bu de'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: Since the undertaking of the action is for the sake of that, the result is the principal purpose.

original: de la ngag thams cad rang gi brjod par bya ba ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ngag thams cad rang gi brjod par bya ba ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni thun mong ba yin no //
translated: In that regard, the action which has the characteristic of indicating the object of expression of all statements is common.

original: de yang shin tu grags pa'i phyir dgos pa nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang shin tu grags pa'i phyir dgos pa nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: And since that is well known, it is not to be taught as the purpose,

original: de ni bstan bcos la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error in the treatise with regard to that.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba med par dogs pa bsal ba'i don du bstan par bya ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba med par dogs pa bsal ba'i don du bstan par bya ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that the treatise is taught in order to remove the doubt that there is nothing to be expressed, that is not so.

original: brjod par bya ba'i khyad bar bstan pa nyid kyis dogs pa bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrjod par bya ba'i khyad par bstan par 'dod pa'i don du de bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i khyad bar bstan pa nyid kyis dogs pa bsal zin pa'i phyir ro // brjod par bya ba'i khyad par bstan par 'dod pa'i don du de bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because the doubt is already removed by the very teaching of the distinction of what is to be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa nyid kyis de bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa nyid kyis de bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it taught in order to teach the distinction of what is to be expressed, because that is already taught by the very teaching of the distinction of what is to be expressed.

original: de lta bas na gang thun mong ma yin pa'i bya ba de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang thun mong ma yin pa'i bya ba de bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the treatise should be taught as having that uncommon function.

original: de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid de yang bstan bcos 'di la yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid de yang bstan bcos 'di la yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that characteristic of the Compendium of Principles is present in this treatise.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos 'dis de kho na nyid de dag de dang der 'thor ba rnams nyan pa po'i blo gcig la 'god ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bsdu ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos 'dis de kho na nyid de dag de dang der 'thor ba rnams nyan pa po'i blo gcig la 'god ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bsdu ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Because this treatise is a compendium characterized by the arrangement in the mind of the listener of those principles scattered here and there.

original: de'i phyir de nyid bsdu ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid bsdu ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is indicated by the word ‚Äúcompendium.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i bya ba 'di'i 'bras bu ni bstan par bya ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i bya ba 'di'i 'bras bu ni bstan par bya ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The result of this activity of the Compendium of Principles is the easy understanding of the principles that are included in the tantra that is taught.

original: de yang bsdus pa'i sgras bsal bar byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa'i sgras bsal bar byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is also indicated by the word ‚Äúcompendium.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid gcig tu bsdus pa ni rtogs pa pos bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gcig tu bsdus pa ni rtogs pa pos bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur gyi //
translated: The principles that are gathered into one are easily understood by the person who is realizing them.

original: rnam par 'thor ba ni dka' bas 'dzin pa'i phyir bde blag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyur bsdus pa'i sgras bsdus pa ston pa na de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du 'di brtsams so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde kho na nyid rtogs pa @140a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba ni dka' bas 'dzin pa'i phyir bde blag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyur bsdus pa'i sgras bsdus pa ston pa na de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du 'di brtsams so zhes bstan pa yin no // de kho na nyid rtogs pa @140a * //
translated: Since it is difficult to apprehend them when they are scattered about, the word ‚Äúcompendium‚Äù is used to indicate that they are gathered into a cause for easy apprehension. When it is taught that this was composed for the purpose of easily understanding the principles,

original: tsam ni 'di'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: tsam ni 'di'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: the mere realization of the principles is not the result of this.

original: de lta na ni sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis de kho na nyid bstan zin pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis de kho na nyid bstan zin pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then since the former masters have already taught reality, it would be pointless to compose this treatise.

original: de'i phyir pha rol rjes su 'dzin ba khyad par can med pa'i phyir dang / bstan bcos kyang gzhan gyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis de kho na nyid bstan zin na yang blo dman pas shin tu 'thor ba nyid kyis bde blag tu gzung bar mi nus pa gang yin pa de la bde blag tu gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid bsdus
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol rjes su 'dzin ba khyad par can med pa'i phyir dang / bstan bcos kyang gzhan gyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis de kho na nyid bstan zin na yang blo dman pas shin tu 'thor ba nyid kyis bde blag tu gzung bar mi nus pa gang yin pa de la bde blag tu gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid bsdus
translated: Therefore, since it is not a special way of caring for others, and since the treatise is for the sake of others,üîΩeven though the former masters have already taught reality, it is not held that composing the Compendium of Principles is pointless, thinking that since those of lesser intellect are unable to easily grasp it due to its great dispersion, it is composed for the sake of easily grasping it.

original: pa brtsam ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin par 'dod do snyam du bsams nas bstan bcos 'di brtsams so ;
analyzed: pa brtsam ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin par 'dod do snyam du bsams nas bstan bcos 'di brtsams so ;
translated: Thinking this, I composed this treatise.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the Compendium of Principles.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: de nyid gtan la dbab pa bya //
analyzed: de nyid gtan la dbab pa bya //
translated: it would be the ascertainment of reality.

original: zhes de skad du bstan par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes de skad du bstan par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is how it should be explained.üîΩüîΩ

original: de ltar na brjod par 'dod pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gsal por bstan par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod par 'dod pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gsal por bstan par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the intended meaning is clearly taught.

original: de lta bas na bsdu ba byed pa'i 'bras bu ni de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsdu ba byed pa'i 'bras bu ni de kho na nyid bde blag tu rtogs pa kho na yin no //
translated: In this way, the result of the compilation is just the easy understanding of reality.

original: bde blag tu rtogs pa de'i yang dgos pa ni yun mi ring bas mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: bde blag tu rtogs pa de'i yang dgos pa ni yun mi ring bas mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of that easy understanding is the attainment of high status and the attainment of definite goodness without delay.

original: de yang rab tu grags pa'i phyir ma brjod de /
analyzed: de yang rab tu grags pa'i phyir ma brjod de /
translated: Since that is well known, it is not mentioned.

original: de kho na nyid shes pa las mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba rnams la grags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na ; 'gro la phan pa mdzad bzhed pas //
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa las mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba rnams la grags pa'i phyir ro // yang na ; 'gro la phan pa mdzad bzhed pas //
translated: Since it is well known to the Sarvastivadins that high status and definite goodness are attained from the knowledge of reality, it is not mentioned.üîΩOr else, it is taught after the line,

original: zhes bya ba'i 'og tu de yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'og tu de yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Desiring to benefit transmigrating beings.

original: 'di lta ste de gang gi don du zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste de gang gi don du zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'gro la phan pa mdzad bzhed pas //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa mdzad bzhed pas //
translated: Since it is intended to benefit beings,

original: de kho na nyid bsdu ba bya //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdu ba bya //
translated: the Compendium of Reality should be composed.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i bya ba 'gro la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i bya ba 'gro la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the activity of composing the Compendium of Reality become the cause for benefiting beings?

original: gal te 'gro ba la phan pa sgrub pa ni de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i 'bras bu yin na 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba la phan pa sgrub pa ni de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i 'bras bu yin na 'gyur te /
translated: If accomplishing the benefit of beings is the effect of the activity of composing the Compendium of Reality, then it would be so.

original: dper na skom pas chu 'on cig ces bya ba 'di la chu 'thung ba de ni len pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu yin par rtogs pa de bzhin du 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: dper na skom pas chu 'on cig ces bya ba 'di la chu 'thung ba de ni len pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu yin par rtogs pa de bzhin du 'di la yang ngo //
translated: For example, in the statement Bring me water for the thirsty, drinking water is understood to be the effect of the activity of bringing. It is the same here.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba la phan pa bsgrub pa'i don du de kho na nyid bsdus pa bya 'o zhes bya ba'i don du gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba la phan pa bsgrub pa'i don du de kho na nyid bsdus pa bya 'o zhes bya ba'i don du gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is established as The Compendium of Reality should be composed for the purpose of accomplishing the benefit of beings.

original: dgos pa 'di la rjes su mthun pa'i thabs can du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa 'di la rjes su mthun pa'i thabs can du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This purpose is shown to be endowed with a suitable means.

original: 'di ltar mngon par mtho ba dang nges bar legs par thob ba ni 'gro ba la phan par brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par mtho ba dang nges bar legs par thob ba ni 'gro ba la phan par brjod la /
translated: Thus, attaining the higher realms and definite goodness is called benefiting beings.

original: de'i rgyu ni phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: Its cause is non-error.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni phyin ci log @140b yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba la phan pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni phyin ci log @140b yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba la phan pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the root of all affliction is error, and because the benefit of beings is the reversal of affliction.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu las bzlog pa 'di'i rgyu yin par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu las bzlog pa 'di'i rgyu yin par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the cause of this is the reversal of that cause.

original: phyin ci ma log par yang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin du yid ches pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par yang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin du yid ches pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Non-error is also the correct belief in the relation between action and result, and the non-erroneous realization of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa'i bstan bcos 'di las thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa'i bstan bcos 'di las thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it arises from this treatise that teaches dependent origination without error, through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: des nas de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i bya bas 'gro ba la phan pa yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba yang khong du chud do //
analyzed: des nas de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i bya bas 'gro ba la phan pa yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba yang khong du chud do //
translated: and then, by the activity of collecting reality, he accomplishes the benefit of beings.üîΩIf one has attained the high states and the definite goodness, then the purpose is fulfilled, because the desired goal is completely achieved.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa yin na mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pas skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam chad pa'i phyir de las gong du dgos pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su ma rdzogs
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa yin na mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pas skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam chad pa'i phyir de las gong du dgos pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su ma rdzogs
translated: There is no need to seek any other purpose beyond that, because the mere desire of the person is cut off.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the purpose incomplete.

original: 'brel pa yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dag las logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dag las logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the connection to be stated separately from the purpose, because it has no result.

original: 'di ltar de ston pa na bstan bcos dang dgos pa gnyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ston pa na bstan bcos dang dgos pa gnyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: For when that is taught, the treatise and the purpose are taught to have the nature of the probandum and the probans.

original: gzhan bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But the other characteristics, such as the succession of teachers, are not.

original: de ni don la 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don la 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a part of the engagement with the meaning.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo de yang dgos pa brjod pa nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo de yang dgos pa brjod pa nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: And that nature of the probandum and probans is indicated by the statement of the purpose.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni 'di'i dgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa na 'di ni 'di'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni 'di'i dgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa na 'di ni 'di'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For when it is indicated that this is the purpose of that, it is indicated that this is the probans of that.

original: gang zhig gang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i dgos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i dgos pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not the probans of something is not its purpose,

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that anything could be the purpose of anything.

original: de lta bas na shugs kyis thob pa'i phyir 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dag las logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na shugs kyis thob pa'i phyir 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dag las logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is implicitly understood, the statement of the purpose should not be stated separately from the statement of the subject and purpose.

original: gang zhig gang brjod na yang mi rtogs pa ni dper na brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa gnyis gang yang rung ba brjod kyang cig shos mi rtogs pa yin pa ltar de las logs shig tu bstan par 'os so //
analyzed: gang zhig gang brjod na yang mi rtogs pa ni dper na brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa gnyis gang yang rung ba brjod kyang cig shos mi rtogs pa yin pa ltar de las logs shig tu bstan par 'os so //
translated: That which is not understood when either of them is stated should be stated separately, just as when either the subject or the purpose is stated, the other is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir dgos pa brjod kyang ji skad du bstan pa'i 'brel pa mi rtogs pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir /üîΩbrjod par bya ba dang dgos pa @141a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgos pa brjod kyang ji skad du bstan pa'i 'brel pa mi rtogs pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir / brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa @141a * //
translated: Because it is impossible that the relation of what is taught is not understood even though the purpose is stated.

original: gnyis kho na brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kho na brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, only the subject matter and the purpose should be stated.

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag kyang kho bo cag gis ngag gi don nyid du rnam par ma phye'i /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag kyang kho bo cag gis ngag gi don nyid du rnam par ma phye'i /
translated: We do not distinguish these subject matter, etc., as the meaning of a statement,

original: 'on kyang ngag las de'i don du cha shas bsdus nas bye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngag las de'i don du cha shas bsdus nas bye ba yin no //
translated: but rather, we collect the parts of a statement for the sake of that.

original: ngag gi don ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdu ba byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi don ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdu ba byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of a statement is the collection of the parts as they have been explained.

original: yang na brjod par bya ba la sogs pa phal par gyur pa yang ngag 'di las rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngag gi don nyid du yang 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na brjod par bya ba la sogs pa phal par gyur pa yang ngag 'di las rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ngag gi don nyid du yang 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Or, even the ordinary subject matter, etc., are not inconsistent as the meaning of a statement, because they are to be understood from this statement.

original: ngag gtso bos don du ma rjod par byed pa ni 'gal gyi /
analyzed: ngag gtso bos don du ma rjod par byed pa ni 'gal gyi /
translated: It is inconsistent for a statement to express many meanings as its primary meaning,

original: gtso bo dang phal pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo dang phal pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as its secondary meaning.

original: ci ste yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rten bcom ldan 'das la ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa kho nas bstod pa brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rten bcom ldan 'das la ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa kho nas bstod pa brjod ce na /
translated: But why is the Lord, the basis of an immeasurable collection of good qualities, praised only by teaching dependent origination?

original: klan ka 'di ni med de /
analyzed: klan ka 'di ni med de /
translated: This objection is not valid,

original: thams cad du brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan dpag tu med pa brjod pa nyid kyis mchod par brjod par bya bar yang mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan dpag tu med pa brjod pa nyid kyis mchod par brjod par bya bar yang mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because the investigation is the same in all cases, and because it is not possible to express worship by merely mentioning immeasurable good qualities.

original: yon tan gyi phyogs gcig brjod pa nyid kyis de brjod do //
analyzed: yon tan gyi phyogs gcig brjod pa nyid kyis de brjod do //
translated: It is expressed by mentioning just one aspect of good qualities.

original: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa brjod pa nyid kyis de brjod pa'am /
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa brjod pa nyid kyis de brjod pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is expressed by merely teaching dependent origination,

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin pa'i phyir khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin pa'i phyir khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
translated: or else, because of the other aspects, there is not the slightest difference.

original: de lta na yang khyad par brjod pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par brjod pa /
translated: Even so, the difference is expressed.

original: 'di ltar yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob bar mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob bar mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ston pa yin no //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is the teacher because he has the perfect view and because he causes migrating beings to attain high status and definite goodness.

original: de nyid mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyur brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyur brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those who seek high status and definite goodness should go for refuge to the BhagavƒÅn and so on.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa nyid kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mngon par mtho ba la sogs pa thob par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa nyid kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mngon par mtho ba la sogs pa thob par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn causes the attainment of high status and so on through teaching dependent arising.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because he teaches dependent arising without error.

original: de'i don nges par bzung ba las bde 'gro'i rgyu las dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa la yid ches pa skye zhing /
analyzed: de'i don nges par bzung ba las bde 'gro'i rgyu las dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa la yid ches pa skye zhing /
translated: From the ascertainment of its meaning, one generates confidence in the unerring cause and effect of happy rebirth.

original: nges par legs pa'i rgyu gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa yang thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis skye'o //
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i rgyu gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa yang thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis skye'o //
translated: The cause of definite goodness is the realization of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, which arises through the stages of listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de skyes na yang 'khor ba'i rgyu ma rig pa ldog go //
analyzed: de skyes na yang 'khor ba'i rgyu ma rig pa ldog go //
translated: When that arises, the cause of cyclic existence, ignorance, is reversed.

original: de log na yang de'i tshe rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag ldog pa'i phyir sgrib ba thams cad dang bral @141b bas byang grol thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log na yang de'i tshe rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag ldog pa'i phyir sgrib ba thams cad dang bral @141b bas byang grol thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is reversed, then at that time, all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, which are rooted in that, are reversed, and one becomes free from all obstructions and attains enlightenment and liberation.

original: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung mngon bar mtho ba la sogs pa 'thob par mdzad pa'i rin po che 'di ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa brjod pa nyid kyis
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung mngon bar mtho ba la sogs pa 'thob par mdzad pa'i rin po che 'di ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa brjod pa nyid kyis
translated: Therefore, since the teaching of dependent arising by the Bhagavat is the chief jewel that brings about the attainment of high rebirth and so forth, by merely correctly explaining dependent arising,

original: bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod do //
translated: I praise the Bhagavat.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang gzhan dag gis mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i dngos po la brten par 'dod de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang gzhan dag gis mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i dngos po la brten par 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, others assert that dependent origination is based on a cause that is incompatible with it, and on a thing that is contradictory to valid knowledge.üîΩTherefore, the Lord Buddha taught it just as it is, by way of refuting that.

original: de lta bas na de bsal ba'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gi brjod par bya ba'i don de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khyad par mang po rnams bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bsal ba'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gi brjod par bya ba'i don de kho na nyid bsdu ba'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khyad par mang po rnams bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: The general meaning is that in order to collect the meaning of reality, which is the topic of the entire treatise that will be explained, he takes up dependent origination, which was explained above, in many different ways.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /üîΩde la / gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste / de la / gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: The meaning of the parts should be stated.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrang bzhin dbang dang gnyi ga dang // bdag sogs bya ba dang bral ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / rang bzhin dbang dang gnyi ga dang // bdag sogs bya ba dang bral ba //
translated: With regard to the line, ‚ÄúWhatever is dependently originated,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the following should be applied everywhere:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is neither arisen from self, nor from another, nor from both, nor without cause,üîΩnor does it exist essentially, nor does it exist without essence.‚Äù

original: de la gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for by whom, etc.

original: gang zhes bya ba spyir brjod du zin kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba spyir brjod du zin kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la 'jug ste /
translated: Although whoever is a general expression, it refers to the Lord Buddha,

original: gzhan la ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities explained in the verse are not possible for others.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas de yang dag par brten nas phung po las sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas de yang dag par brten nas phung po las sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Dependent origination is the arising of the aggregates, etc., in dependence on causes and conditions.  Dependent means in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: ji skad du rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phung po la sogs pa gang gis gsungs ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phung po la sogs pa gang gis gsungs ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, Whatever arises in dependence on causes and conditions, that is explained to be dependently originated.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although arising is taught as if it were something separate,

original: 'on kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spang ba rtsam shes par 'dod pa la de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spang ba rtsam shes par 'dod pa la de skad du bstan to //
translated: nevertheless, dependent origination is taught in this way for the sake of understanding that it is merely the thing itself, with no other distinction.

original: yang na 'byung bar byed pas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'byung bar byed pas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Or else, they are elements because they cause arising.

original: kri tya lya too bar ba hu lam zhes bya bar ba hu la zhes 'byung bar byed pa po'i rkyen gha yin no //
analyzed: kri tya lya too bar ba hu lam zhes bya bar ba hu la zhes 'byung bar byed pa po'i rkyen gha yin no //
translated: The word bh≈´ta is derived from the root bh≈´, to arise, and the suffix tya, which indicates an agent.

original: de nas pra ti tya'i sgra dang bsdu ba bya ste /
analyzed: de nas pra ti tya'i sgra dang bsdu ba bya ste /
translated: Then the word pratƒ´tya is added, which means ‚Äúhaving arisen.‚Äù

original: sub su pe ti ma yu r'a bhy'am sa ka la sogs pa nyid byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sub su pe ti ma yu r'a bhy'am sa ka la sogs pa nyid byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word pratƒ´tya is derived from the root tyaj, to leave, and the prefix prati, which indicates the cause.

original: yang na bsdu ba med ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsdu ba med ba kho na yin no //
translated: Or else, the word pratƒ´tya is not derived from the root tyaj.

original: de ltar na sngar ni med pa kho na yin pas ma byas la //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar ni med pa kho na yin pas ma byas la //
translated: Thus, the effect did not exist previously, and so it is not produced.

original: phyis ni dgos sam sems nas bcug go //üîΩrang bzhin ni grangs can gyis kun tu brtags pa'i rdul dang mun pa dang @142a * //
analyzed: phyis ni dgos sam sems nas bcug go // rang bzhin ni grangs can gyis kun tu brtags pa'i rdul dang mun pa dang @142a * //
translated: Later, it is produced by the will of God.

original: snying stobs kyi rang bzhin te gtso bo'o //
analyzed: snying stobs kyi rang bzhin te gtso bo'o //
translated: Nature is the primal substance, which is the cause of the world according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: dbang ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: dbang ni dbang phyug go //
translated: God is the ruler.

original: gnyig ni de dag kho na gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyig ni de dag kho na gnyis so //
translated: Both are the primal substance and God.

original: bdag ni 'byin pa dang sdud par byed pa'i skyes bu ste de las gzhan yang 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni 'byin pa dang sdud par byed pa'i skyes bu ste de las gzhan yang 'khor ba yin no //
translated: The self is the person who emits and withdraws.

original: sogs pa smos pas dus la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas dus la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes time and so on.

original: de dag gi bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The activity of these is the nature of the cause.

original: de dang bral ba ni de'i bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni de'i bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Being devoid of that is the meaning of ‚Äúempty of activity.‚Äù

original: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis myu gu de yang rang nyid kyis byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis myu gu de yang rang nyid kyis byas pa ma yin /
translated: The Blessed One has said that the sprout is not produced by itself,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin /üîΩgnyi gas byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin / gnyi gas byas pa ma yin /
translated: not produced by another,üîΩnot produced by both,

original: dbang phyug gis sprul pa ma yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis sprul pa ma yin //
translated: not created by ƒ™≈õvara,

original: dus yongs su gyur pa ma yin /
analyzed: dus yongs su gyur pa ma yin /
translated: not arisen by transformation of time,

original: rang bzhin las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin las byung ba ma yin /
translated: not born from the intrinsic nature,

original: rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin /
translated: not dependent on a single cause,

original: rgyu med pa las skye ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and not arisen causelessly.

original: 'dis ni gtso bo dang / dbang phyug dang / gnyi ga'i rgyu can dang / sgra'i tshangs pa dang / bdag brtag pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gtso bo dang / dbang phyug dang / gnyi ga'i rgyu can dang / sgra'i tshangs pa dang / bdag brtag pa rnams bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the cause is not the primal substance, ƒ™≈õvara, both, sound, BrahmƒÅ, or the self.

original: ci ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ci skad cig ma ma yin par gsungs sam zhe na ma yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: ci ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ci skad cig ma ma yin par gsungs sam zhe na ma yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: It is said that it is not.

original: g-yo ba ste g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba ste g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMoving‚Äù means unstable, momentary.

original: gzhan la ni g-yo ba nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni g-yo ba nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that it is not suitable for anything else to be moving.

original: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said:

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.

original: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod //
analyzed: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod //
translated: How can they be nonabiding?

original: 'di dag 'byung ba de nyid ni //üîΩbya ba de nyid byed par brjod //
analyzed: 'di dag 'byung ba de nyid ni // bya ba de nyid byed par brjod //
translated: The arising of these

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: is said to be the activity of that.

original: 'dis ni brtan pa'i dngos po brtag pa bstan to //üîΩgal te de lta na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la brten nas las dang 'brel bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni brtan pa'i dngos po brtag pa bstan to // gal te de lta na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la brten nas las dang 'brel bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: This teaches the investigation of stable things.

original: gyo ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gyo ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the presentation of the connection between karma and its result and so on would not be established because dependent origination is momentary.üîΩIf you say that it is not established because it moves, then that is not so.

original: de'i phyir las dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúaction, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that this will be taught later.

original: de la las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Therein, action is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Its result is desirable and undesirable.

original: de dag gi 'brel pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi 'brel pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Their relation is the characteristic of the nature of that which is produced and that which produces.

original: de'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yang dag par gnas pa dang tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yang dag par gnas pa dang tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its establishment is the correct existence and convention.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dran pa dang / ngo shes ba dang / the tshom dang / nges ba dang / rang gis gtams pa len pa dang / don mthong ba la ngo mtshar dang bral ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma dang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dran pa dang / ngo shes ba dang / the tshom dang / nges ba dang / rang gis gtams pa len pa dang / don mthong ba la ngo mtshar dang bral ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma dang /
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include memory, recognition, doubt, certainty, taking up what is personally determined, freedom from wonder at seeing the meaning, the fact of cause and effect, the valid cognition that realizes that,

original: bcings pa dang / thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa @142b gzung ngo //
analyzed: bcings pa dang / thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa @142b gzung ngo //
translated: and the establishment of bondage, liberation, etc.

original: de dag gi rten zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rten zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is supplied.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis kye dge slong dag 'di la las yod do //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis kye dge slong dag 'di la las yod do //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúO monks, here there is karma,

original: 'bras bu yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod do //
translated: and there is its result.

original: gang chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa phung po 'di 'dor zhing phung bo gzhan nye bar len pa'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa phung po 'di 'dor zhing phung bo gzhan nye bar len pa'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so //
translated: Apart from the conventional designation of dharmas, one does not perceive an agent who casts off these aggregates and grasps those aggregates.

original: de la chos su brdar btags pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la chos su brdar btags pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: And this is the conventional designation of dharmas:

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄòWhen this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises. ‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'dis ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the investigation of the relation between karma and its result.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams su yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams su yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: This dependent origination should be seen in terms of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: de dag nyid rten nas byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de dag nyid rten nas byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because they arise in dependence.

original: 'on te rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there also real things, such as substance, quality, and action?

original: de dag ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not?

original: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te /
analyzed: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te /
translated: He says: because of the absence of qualities, etc.

original: yon tan dang / rdzas dang / bya ba dang / rigs dang / 'du ba dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang / rdzas dang / bya ba dang / rigs dang / 'du ba dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
translated: The absence of qualities, substances, actions, universals, and collections is to be understood by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: rigs kyi sgras khyab pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi rnam pa gnyis gzung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgras khyab pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi rnam pa gnyis gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù includes both the all-pervading and the limited universal.

original: sogs kyi sgras brtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rnams te /
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras brtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rnams te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the particular inherent nature of the imagined.

original: gang dag gis chos can las tha dad pa'i chos 'ga' zhig brjod pa dper na tshig gi don drug po'i yod pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag gis chos can las tha dad pa'i chos 'ga' zhig brjod pa dper na tshig gi don drug po'i yod pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de dag gzung ngo //
translated: Those are the absences of any qualities, etc., which are different from the substratum, for example, the existence of the six categories is the object of a valid cognition that has an object.

original: yon tan la sogs pa yang de yin la khyad par te bye brag kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa yang de yin la khyad par te bye brag kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: The absence of those is the absence of qualities, etc., which are particularities, or distinctions.

original: de dag gis stong pa ni bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gis stong pa ni bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúabsence‚Äù is ‚Äúdevoid of.‚Äù

original: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has stated this:

original: bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang / skye mche da bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad kyi bar dag go ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang / skye mche da bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad kyi bar dag go ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Brahmin, ‚Äúall of everything‚Äù refers to the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements.

original: 'dis ni tshig gi don drug brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig gi don drug brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the analysis of the six topics.

original: 'on te khyad par med na ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis yul du byed de /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par med na ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis yul du byed de /
translated: But if there is no difference, how can dependent origination be taken as an object by means of words and thoughts?

original: de dag gi yul du ma byas na brjod par mi nus shing /
analyzed: de dag gi yul du ma byas na brjod par mi nus shing /
translated: If it is not taken as an object, it cannot be expressed.

original: khyad par med na sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag 'jug pa yang med na de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan ce na /
analyzed: khyad par med na sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag 'jug pa yang med na de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan ce na /
translated: And if there is no difference, then words and thoughts do not apply. So how can the Blessed One have taught it?

original: sgro btags pas rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgro btags pas rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is said to be a form of superimposition,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgro btags pa ni phyi rol nyid du sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul gang la yod @143a * //
analyzed: sgro btags pa ni phyi rol nyid du sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul gang la yod @143a * //
translated: Superimposition is the nature of the form of superimposition that is superimposed as external. It is the domain of words and consciousness.

original: pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it is called.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang la sgro btags pa'i rnam ba sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul gyi yul yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang la sgro btags pa'i rnam ba sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul gyi yul yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the object of the domain of sound and cognition, which is the superimposition on dependent origination, is what it is called.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang nya ba'i phyir nang gi brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'i khyad par rnam par rtog pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang nya ba'i phyir nang gi brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'i khyad par rnam par rtog pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Cognition‚Äù should be seen as a particular kind of cognition that is internal, has the nature of expression, and is conceptual, because it is the result of sound and the object.

original: de dag ni yul gcig la 'khrul pa med pa nyid kyis lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yul gcig la 'khrul pa med pa nyid kyis lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are co-existent because they are not mistaken with regard to the same object.

original: des na 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being taught:

original: khyad par med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: khyad par med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although there is no difference,

original: 'on kyang phan tshun ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid sgra'i don de la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phan tshun ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid sgra'i don de la yod pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, the object of sound, which is the nature of an image of conceptualization, is external, because it is conceived to be external through the perception of mutually exclusive entities.

original: 'dir sgra rnams kyi spyod yul ni don dam par ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgra rnams kyi spyod yul ni don dam par ma yin te /
translated: Here, the domain of sounds is not ultimately.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang 'jig rten na ma brtags na nyams dga' bar sgra'i don grub pa ji lta ba de kho na ltar de kho na nyid kyi don btang snyoms su mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang glang po che'i lta stangs kyis don dam pa la 'jug pa'i don
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang 'jig rten na ma brtags na nyams dga' bar sgra'i don grub pa ji lta ba de kho na ltar de kho na nyid kyi don btang snyoms su mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang glang po che'i lta stangs kyis don dam pa la 'jug pa'i don
translated: Because it transcends all conceptualization.üîΩNevertheless, just as the meaning of a word is established in the world without analysis and is delightful, in the same way, the meaning of reality is also delightful.

original: du brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu bstan te /
analyzed: du brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One, who is indifferent to the meaning of reality, has also taught the ultimate by means of conventional expressions, using the elephant gaze.

original: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other method.

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa can yin na yang sgra'i don brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa can yin na yang sgra'i don brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it has the form of superimposition, the meaning of the word is indirectly related to the thing.

original: de rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po de dag shugs kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir slu ba mi srid do //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po de dag shugs kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir slu ba mi srid do //
translated: Since it exists as the cause for understanding that, the thing that has that form is indirectly understood. Therefore, deception is impossible.

original: de la 'di ni skyob pas /üîΩming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: de la 'di ni skyob pas / ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Here, the Protector has said:üîΩWhatever names

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: are used to express whatever phenomena,

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of phenomena.

original: de ni de la yod ma yin ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de la yod ma yin ; / zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist in that.

original: 'dis ni sgra'i don brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgra'i don brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the examination of the meaning of the words.

original: yang ci 'di mu stegs byed kyis kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma'i nor gyis dbul ba nyid kyis tshig bkod pa'i rtsom pa tsam snying por gyur pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci 'di mu stegs byed kyis kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma'i nor gyis dbul ba nyid kyis tshig bkod pa'i rtsom pa tsam snying por gyur pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is this just a composition of words that has become the essence of the poverty of valid cognition that understands things as imagined by non-Buddhists?

original: 'on te 'di'i rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad cig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di'i rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad cig yod ce na /
translated: Or does it have some valid cognition that understands it?

original: smras pa / yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / yod do //
translated: We say: It does.

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The so-called definition of manifestation and so on.

original: de ni mtshan nyid kyang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas zhes khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid kyang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas zhes khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is a definition and it is also a manifestation, so it is a particular inclusion.

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi srid pa dang / ma khyab pa dang / ha cang khyab pa'i skyon dang @143b bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi srid pa dang / ma khyab pa dang / ha cang khyab pa'i skyon dang @143b bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of manifestation is free from the faults of impossibility, non-pervasion, and over-pervasion.

original: mu stegs byed kyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ces bstan to //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ces bstan to //
translated: The definition of valid cognition for the tƒ´rthikas is unclear. To teach that, the definition of clarity is taught.

original: de dang ldan pa ni de dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni de dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing that is being endowed with that.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gnyis po gang yin pa des gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gnyis po gang yin pa des gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: That which is ascertained by the two valid cognitions called direct perception and inference.

original: 'di yang brtag pa thams cad du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa thams cad du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown in all the examinations.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyang bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyang bzhed pa yin te /
translated: This is also accepted by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dgag gam mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: dge slong dgag gam mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: Monks, whether learned or not,

original: bsreg bcad brdar bas gser bzhin du //
analyzed: bsreg bcad brdar bas gser bzhin du //
translated: Like gold is tested by burning, cutting, and rubbing,

original: yongs su brtags na nga yi bka' //
analyzed: yongs su brtags na nga yi bka' //
translated: My words should be examined

original: blang bar bya yi gus phyir min ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya yi gus phyir min ; / zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: And accepted, not out of respect for me.

original: de la mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma 'khrul pa dang rtog pa dang bral pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma 'khrul pa dang rtog pa dang bral pa nyid de /
translated: There, the definition of direct perception is non-deceptive and free from conceptuality.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: And that is also stated by the BhagavƒÅn:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'i snyam du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'i snyam du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: The sutra says, One knows blue by means of the eye consciousness, but not by thinking 'blue.'

original: 'di ltar sngon po zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can du bstan pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can du bstan pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba brjod la /
translated: Thus, by saying blue, it is said that it is non-erroneous because it is a non-mistaken subject.

original: sngon po'i snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni ming dang 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid brjod do //
analyzed: sngon po'i snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni ming dang 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid brjod do //
translated: By saying but not by thinking 'blue,' it is said that it is free from conceptualization because it abandons apprehending an object connected with a name.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rten rtags ston pa na gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rten rtags ston pa na gsungs te /
translated: The definition of inference is also stated when teaching the reason, the basis of inference.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags nges pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags nges pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, a definite reason that does not occur if the object to be established does not exist is the cause of inferential knowledge.

original: de yang dge slong dag gang cung zad kun 'byung ba'i chos yin pa de thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu bsgrub byas gtan tshigs la khyab ba bstan pas na gsal ba rab tu bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang dge slong dag gang cung zad kun 'byung ba'i chos yin pa de thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu bsgrub byas gtan tshigs la khyab ba bstan pas na gsal ba rab tu bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the probandum is taught to pervade the reason, and thus the clarity is fully taught.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: med na mi 'gyur mtshan nyid can //üîΩrtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur mtshan nyid can // rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
translated: The definition of that which does not occur without itüîΩis the reason that is the basis of inference.

original: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab pa ni //
analyzed: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab pa ni //
translated: The probandum pervades the reason,

original: bstan pa de yang gsal bar bshad //
analyzed: bstan pa de yang gsal bar bshad //
translated: and that teaching is also clearly explained.

original: ces gsungs pa bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa bzhin yin no //
translated: This is just as it is said.

original: rtags de yang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: rtags de yang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: That reason is also divided into three types by the distinctions of nature, effect, and non-observation.

original: de la dge slong gang dag cung zad skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin gyis rtags bstan to //
analyzed: de la dge slong gang dag cung zad skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin gyis rtags bstan to //
translated: Among those, the monks, whatever is a phenomenon that is a source of suffering, this teaches the reason of nature.

original: 'bras bu yang /üîΩdu ba las ni mer shes te //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang / du ba las ni mer shes te //
translated: The effect is also:üîΩFrom smoke, one knows fire,

original: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
analyzed: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
translated: and from the osprey, one knows water.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyi //üîΩrigs ni mtshan ma @144a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyi // rigs ni mtshan ma @144a * //
translated: The family of the wise bodhisattva

original: rnams las shes //
analyzed: rnams las shes //
translated: is known from the signs.

original: zhes gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: mi dmigs pa'i khyad par yang mi dmigs pa tsam tshad ma yin pa spong pa na bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i khyad par yang mi dmigs pa tsam tshad ma yin pa spong pa na bstan pa nyid de /
translated: The distinctive feature of nonapprehension is taught in the refutation of the mere nonapprehension as a valid cognition,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag gi tshod ma 'dzin cig / dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag gi tshod 'dzin pa ni nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag gi tshod ma 'dzin cig / dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag gi tshod 'dzin pa ni nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, do not estimate the worth of a person by yourself. Monks, the estimation of the worth of a person by yourself is a loss.

original: da 'am nga dang 'dra bas gang zag gi tshod gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: da 'am nga dang 'dra bas gang zag gi tshod gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Either I or someone like me should estimate the worth of a person.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa tsam tshad ma yin pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa tsam tshad ma yin pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the mere apprehension of the transcendent, etc., as a valid cognition by nature.

original: nga'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas ni mi dmigs ba'i khyad par tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang gsal bar rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas ni mi dmigs ba'i khyad par tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang gsal bar rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The distinctive feature of nonapprehension as a valid cognition is clearly taught by the words ‚ÄúI or someone like me,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dis kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This also shows the examination of perception, inference, etc.

original: yang ci ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di 'gyur ba smra bas ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di 'gyur ba smra bas ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa yin nam /
translated: Now, is this dependent origination something that has a universal character, like the one described by the Grammarians?

original: 'o na te ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin //
analyzed: 'o na te ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin //
translated: Or is it something that has a unique character?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from this?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'chol ba yin pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'chol ba yin pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it has a universal character, then the definition of perception, etc. is confused, and cause and effect are not cause and effect, because they are not different in nature.

original: de lta bas na gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshad ma gnyis gyis nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshad ma gnyis gyis nges pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained by the two valid cognitions that have the character of perception.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And the meaning of dependent origination is not reasonable.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi bye brag khyad par med pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi bye brag khyad par med pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro
translated: Even though their own natures are distinct, they are not causes because they do not have the specific features of co-operating causes, like things that are not accepted as causes.

original: // 'dir smras pa /üîΩgzhan gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // 'dir smras pa / gzhan gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'dir 'di snyam du phyogs phyi ma nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di snyam du phyogs phyi ma nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Here, he thinks that the latter position is not correct.

original: 'di la ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyi go skabs med do zhes phyi nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyi go skabs med do zhes phyi nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: Later, we will show that there is no opportunity for the faults that have been explained to occur.

original: 'bras bu la gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: The effect is mixed with the other nature,

original: 'chol ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'chol ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: the word ‚Äúmixed‚Äù is a compound.

original: rgyu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan 'bras bu la sogs pa gang la cha tsam yang rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan 'bras bu la sogs pa gang la cha tsam yang rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of the cause and so on does not follow in the slightest way into the effect and so on. This is the meaning.

original: phra rab kyis kyang zhes bya ba la kyang gi @144b sgras ni yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad shin tu phra bas kyang zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phra rab kyis kyang zhes bya ba la kyang gi @144b sgras ni yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad shin tu phra bas kyang zhes bstan to //
translated: The word also in even the subtle indicates that not only the many such as existence and so on, but also the very subtle are not the self.

original: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba yin na yang bdag nyid thams cad rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba yin na yang bdag nyid thams cad rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that even if there were a single nature that is omnipresent, it would have to be omnipresent in all aspects.

original: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar myu gu rtag ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar myu gu rtag ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Blessed One said, The sprout is not permanent?

original: gang gi phyir myu gu yang gzhan sa bon yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir myu gu yang gzhan sa bon yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Because the sprout is one thing and the seed is another.

original: myu gu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon ma yin te /
analyzed: myu gu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon ma yin te /
translated: The sprout itself is not the seed.

original: de lta bas na sa bon 'dra ba las myu gu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa bon 'dra ba las myu gu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the sprout arises from what is similar to the seed.

original: de lta bas na mi 'pho zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi 'pho zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it does not transmigrate.

original: 'dis kyang ma nges pa smras pa brtags pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang ma nges pa smras pa brtags pa bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the opponent's statement is inconclusive.

original: 'on te ci phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa rnams kyang thams cad yod par smra bar 'pho bar smra ba kha cig gis ji skad du smras pa bzhin du dus rnams su rang gi ngo bo mdor bar 'jug pa yin nam zhe
analyzed: 'on te ci phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa rnams kyang thams cad yod par smra bar 'pho bar smra ba kha cig gis ji skad du smras pa bzhin du dus rnams su rang gi ngo bo mdor bar 'jug pa yin nam zhe
translated: Or do some who transfer to the assertion that all exist assert that the unmixed intrinsic reality of the aggregates and so on enters the three times?

original: na / de lta ma yin no zhes smras pa /üîΩmi 'pho zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: na / de lta ma yin no zhes smras pa / mi 'pho zhes bya ba la /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: gal te 'pho ba yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa'i phyir cung zad kyang bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'pho ba yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa'i phyir cung zad kyang bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not transfer‚Äù means that if it transferred, then because it would exist in all times, it would not be produced in the least, and so dependent origination would be untenable.

original: gang la phung po la sogs pa rnams dus rnams su rgyu ba'i 'pho ba yod pa ma yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la phung po la sogs pa rnams dus rnams su rgyu ba'i 'pho ba yod pa ma yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not transfer‚Äù is applied to the aggregates and so on.

original: 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te / ji skad du /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said this:

original: mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang thim nas mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang thim nas mi 'gro ste /
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere to dissolve.

original: dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Bhik·π£us, the eye arises from what was not, and having arisen, it ceases.

original: 'dis kyang dus gsum brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dus gsum brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the analysis of the three times.

original: 'on te ci 'di ji ltar /
analyzed: 'on te ci 'di ji ltar /
translated: But how is this?

original: tshu rol mdzes pa ba rnams kyis //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa ba rnams kyis //
translated: The LokƒÅyatas say,

original: shi nas thal bar gyur pa la //
analyzed: shi nas thal bar gyur pa la //
translated: ‚ÄúAfter death, one becomes ashes.

original: slar skye ba lta ga la yod //
analyzed: slar skye ba lta ga la yod //
translated: How can there be rebirth?‚Äù

original: ces smras pa ltar mthong ba'i dus tsam du 'byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ces smras pa ltar mthong ba'i dus tsam du 'byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do they arise just at the time they are seen?

original: ma yin no zhes smras pa /üîΩthog ma tha med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes smras pa / thog ma tha med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: We say they do not.üîΩThe Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, in the cycle of rebirth there is no beginning or end.‚Äù

original: 'di la thog ma dang tha ma yod pa ma yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la thog ma dang tha ma yod pa ma yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The sentence should be analyzed as follows: ‚ÄúIt does not have a beginning or an end.‚Äù

original: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'khor ba'i skye bi na thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'khor ba'i skye bi na thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMonks, in the cycle of rebirth there is no beginning or end.‚Äù

original: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dang po la brjod la /
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dang po la brjod la /
translated: The word ‚Äúbeginning‚Äù refers to the first.

original: tha ma ni mthar brjod do //
analyzed: tha ma ni mthar brjod do //
translated: The last is mentioned at the end.

original: de dag bkag pas thog ma tha med ba zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di @145a * //
analyzed: de dag bkag pas thog ma tha med ba zhes bya'o // 'di @145a * //
translated: By the negation of these, it is said that there is no beginning or end.

original: yang 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
translated: This is also stated from the point of view of the non-arising of the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa rnams la ni 'khor ba mtha' dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
