analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa rnams la ni 'khor ba mtha' dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: But for those in whom the noble path has arisen, samsara is finite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: For this very reason it is said:üîΩFor the childish who do not know the true Dharma,

original: byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring // zhes gsungs so //
translated: samsara is long.

original: 'dis kyang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa brtag pa bstan to //üîΩ'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di phyi rol gyi don gyi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa brtag pa bstan to // 'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di phyi rol gyi don gyi bdag nyid dam /
translated: This also shows the examination of the Lokayatas.

original: 'on te sems tsam gyi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems tsam gyi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: But is this dependent origination of the nature of external objects or is it of the nature of mind only?

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs lta bu ste //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs lta bu ste // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is like a reflection, etc.

original: 'dis ni sems tsam gyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems tsam gyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows that it is of the nature of mind only.

original: 'di ltar 'di skad du ji ltar gzugs brnyan dang mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa sems tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skad du ji ltar gzugs brnyan dang mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa sems tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that just as a reflection, a firebrand wheel, a city of gandharvas, and so on are the nature of mind only, so is this.

original: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /üîΩji ltar byis pa rnams brtags ltar //
analyzed: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis / ji ltar byis pa rnams brtags ltar //
translated: This is also taught by the Blessed One:

original: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
translated: External objects do not exist as they are imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by the latent propensities

original: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung // zhes gsungs so //
translated: appears as external objects.

original: 'dis kyang phyi rol gyi don brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang phyi rol gyi don brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the investigation of external objects.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji skad du bshad pa'i don med pa'i rtog pa'i 'dra ba dang bral ba nyid bstan nas ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji skad du bshad pa'i don med pa'i rtog pa'i 'dra ba dang bral ba nyid bstan nas ;
translated: Therefore, in this way, having taught that dependent origination is free from the semblance of unreal imagination, as it has been explained,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir spros pa'i tshogs kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir spros pa'i tshogs kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to summarize, he says, ‚Äúthe entire collection of conceptual elaborations,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa nyid la sogs pa spros pa thams cad kyi tshogs ni 'dus pa ste nge las grol ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa nyid la sogs pa spros pa thams cad kyi tshogs ni 'dus pa ste nge las grol ba'o //
translated: The collection of all elaborations, such as having a cause of the nature explained above, is the aggregate.

original: 'on te ci 'di khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis kyang de bzhin du rtogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci 'di khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis kyang de bzhin du rtogs sam zhe na /
translated: But is it understood in the same way by others, such as Vi·π£·πáu, Mahe≈õvara, and Garu·∏ça?

original: ma yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: No, he says.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pha ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pha ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not understood by others.

original: mu stegs byed thams cad ni ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ma 'dres pa'i mkhyen pa yin no zhes ba stan to //
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad ni ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ma 'dres pa'i mkhyen pa yin no zhes ba stan to //
translated: This shows that the Blessed One alone has the unique knowledge that all tƒ´rthikas are mistaken because they are attached to the view of a self that is not reality.

original: 'di yang brtag pa thams cad du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa thams cad du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown in all the analyses.

original: ci ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyis mkhyen nas gsungs sam /
analyzed: ci ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyis mkhyen nas gsungs sam /
translated: But did the Blessed One teach this dependent origination that is such a profound topic after understanding it himself?

original: 'on te rgyal dpog pa rnams ji skad du //
analyzed: 'on te rgyal dpog pa rnams ji skad du //
translated: Or, like the Jaiminiyas, do you say that

original: de phyir dbang po las 'das don //
analyzed: de phyir dbang po las 'das don //
translated: The meaning of the Vedas is beyond the senses,

original: dngos @145b su mthong ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos @145b su mthong ba yod ma yin //
translated: And that there is no direct perception of it?

original: tshig ni rtag pa gang zhig gis //
analyzed: tshig ni rtag pa gang zhig gis //
translated: And that the words of the Vedas are eternal,

original: mthong ba de ni mthong ma yin //üîΩzhes smras pa ltar gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bus ma byas pa'i rig byed kyi tshig la brten nas mkhyen te gsungs she na /
analyzed: mthong ba de ni mthong ma yin // zhes smras pa ltar gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bus ma byas pa'i rig byed kyi tshig la brten nas mkhyen te gsungs she na /
translated: And that what is seen by them is not seen?

original: de ltar ma yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: We reply that this is not so.

original: rang dbang thos dang 'brel med cing //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: rang dbang thos dang 'brel med cing // zhes smos te /
translated: The Vedas are not independent, nor are they related to what is heard.

original: rang dbang thos pa ni rang las tshad mar gyur pa ste tshig rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang dbang thos pa ni rang las tshad mar gyur pa ste tshig rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Vedas are not valid by themselves; this is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthe words are eternal.‚Äù

original: de dang 'brel pa med pa ni mi gnas pa de la ltos pa med pa nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa med pa ni mi gnas pa de la ltos pa med pa nyid kho na ste /
translated: They are not related to what is heard, that is, they do not depend on something else, that is, they do not depend on something else that is permanent.

original: dngos su gzigs nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos su gzigs nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the Buddha taught dependent origination after directly seeing it.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There are no words that are not created by a person.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavat has said,

original: kun dga' bo de ltar na sngon gyi dran srong chen po de dag rig byed dag gi byed pa po dang / sngags rnams kyi 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ltar na sngon gyi dran srong chen po de dag rig byed dag gi byed pa po dang / sngags rnams kyi 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAnanda, in this way, the great sages of the past are the authors of the Vedas and the expounders of the mantras.‚Äù

original: 'di yang phyis bstan bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis bstan bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: He thought that this should be taught later.

original: 'dis kyang thos pa brtag pa dang / rang las tshad ma brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang thos pa brtag pa dang / rang las tshad ma brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the investigation of scripture and the investigation of self-validating cognition.

original: ci ste bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa thugs su chud na ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci ste bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa thugs su chud na ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: If the Bhagavat has realized all of his own aims, why did he teach this dependent origination?

original: 'gro phan mdzad par bzhed pa yis /üîΩzhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'gro phan mdzad par bzhed pa yis / zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Because he wishes to benefit the world.

original: /'gro phan ni 'gro ba la phan pa'o //
analyzed: /'gro phan ni 'gro ba la phan pa'o //
translated: He wishes to benefit the world, to help the world.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i thabs can nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i thabs can nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, he is the one who has eliminated all the afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known, and who possesses the method for understanding dependent origination without error.

original: de mdzad par bzhed pa ni 'gro la phan bar mdzad pa bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: de mdzad par bzhed pa ni 'gro la phan bar mdzad pa bzhed pa'o //
translated: The desire to act is the desire to act for the benefit of beings.

original: de ni de ston pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ston pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause for teaching.

original: 'di'i 'gro ba la phan par mdzad par bzhed pa de yang ga las byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'gro ba la phan par mdzad par bzhed pa de yang ga las byung zhe na /
translated: From where does that desire to act for the benefit of beings arise?

original: bskal ba grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúincalculable eons,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la bskal pa grangs med pa mi nyung bar thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes tshig rnam par spyar ro //
analyzed: gang la bskal pa grangs med pa mi nyung bar thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes tshig rnam par spyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúincalculable eons‚Äù should be connected with the phrase ‚Äúin the nature of great compassion.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa brnyes na yang gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i bya ba yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir thugs rje chen po de yang mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa brnyes na yang gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i bya ba yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir thugs rje chen po de yang mnga' ba yin no //
translated: Even though the Lord has attained every aspect of perfection for his own benefit, he also possesses great compassion because he does not abandon the activity of acting for the benefit of others.

original: ci ste thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa 'dis ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci ste thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa 'dis ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: If he becomes the embodiment of great compassion, what does he do?

original: goms mdzad pa gang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: goms mdzad pa gang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúby the power of his practice.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang gis zhes bya ba spyi'i tshig yin yang @146a * //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba spyi'i tshig yin yang @146a * //
translated: Although the word ‚Äúhis‚Äù is a general term,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la 'jug ste /
translated: it refers to the Lord Buddha,

original: gzhan la ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no one else has the qualities explained above.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten pa ste /
translated: He says, ‚Äúdependent origination‚Äù means dependent on causes and conditions.

original: yang dag par kun nas brten pas yang dag par kun nas brten nas phung po la sogs pa 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: yang dag par kun nas brten pas yang dag par kun nas brten nas phung po la sogs pa 'byung ba dag go //
translated: Since they are completely dependent, the aggregates and so on arise in complete dependence.

original: de skad du rgyu dang rten gyi stobs las 'byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa gang gis gsungs ba zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du rgyu dang rten gyi stobs las 'byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa gang gis gsungs ba zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the aggregates and so on arise by the power of causes and supports.

original: 'di ltar yang 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba tha dad pa nyid du bstan pa de lta na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba tha dad pa nyid du bstan pa de lta na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na dngos po yin te /
translated: Thus, although dependent origination is taught as a separate thing, it is dependent origination itself that is a thing.

original: tha dad pa gzhan dor ba tsam shes par 'dod pas de ltar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan dor ba tsam shes par 'dod pas de ltar bshad pa'o //
translated: Since it is asserted that it is known as the mere exclusion of other, different things, it is explained in that way.

original: yang na 'brel par 'byung bas na 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'brel par 'byung bas na 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is dependent origination because it originates in dependence.

original: mang po'i tshig gi byed pa'i rkyen sbyar te /üîΩrten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig gi byed pa'i rkyen sbyar te / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The suffix ya is applied to the word for origination to indicate the instrumental case.üîΩSince it is dependent origination itself, it is dependent origination.

original: bsdu ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or it is the mere exclusion of other things.

original: 'di thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag pa'i thabs can yin bar gsal bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag pa'i thabs can yin bar gsal bar byas pa yin te /
translated: All of this clarifies that the BhagavƒÅn is one who is endowed with the perfect means for accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de lta bur gyur pa gang gis gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la phan par sgrub pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de lta bur gyur pa gang gis gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la phan par sgrub pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the statement, ‚ÄúThe Lord of Sages, the Blessed One, who has taught the truth of dependent origination in this way,‚Äù shows how the Blessed One is the one who accomplishes the welfare of others in accordance with reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan dag la mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa gang yin pa 'di nyid phan pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan dag la mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa gang yin pa 'di nyid phan pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One is the one who accomplishes the welfare of others in that he teaches the unmistaken path to heaven and liberation to others.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ston pa po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ston pa po //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the teacher;

original: khyed cag nyid kyis bya ba yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyed cag nyid kyis bya ba yin // zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: it is up to you to do it.

original: gzhan la phan ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa phyin ci ma log pa 'di'i thabs ni /
analyzed: gzhan la phan ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa phyin ci ma log pa 'di'i thabs ni /
translated: The means for accomplishing the welfare of others in this unmistaken way is

original: chos rnams dngos su gzigs pa dang / thugs rje chen po yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos su gzigs pa dang / thugs rje chen po yin no //
translated: the direct perception of phenomena and great compassion.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje can yin yang yang dag ba ji ltar ba bzhin du mi shes na gzhan la phan pa yang dag pa ston par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje can yin yang yang dag ba ji ltar ba bzhin du mi shes na gzhan la phan pa yang dag pa ston par mi nus so //
translated: Even if one has compassion, if one does not know reality, one cannot teach the welfare of others correctly.

original: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa yin na yang brtse ba las nyams pas ni mi ston pa yin la /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa yin na yang brtse ba las nyams pas ni mi ston pa yin la /
translated: But if he has the knowledge, he does not teach out of compassion for the person.

original: ston na yang mi phan pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston na yang mi phan pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he does teach, he teaches what is not beneficial.

original: de lta pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje dang shes rab gnyi ga yang gzhan la phan pa yang dag phan sgrub pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: de lta pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje dang shes rab gnyi ga yang gzhan la phan pa yang dag phan sgrub pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the compassion and wisdom of the Lord are the means of accomplishing the highest benefit for others.

original: dngos su gzigs @146b pa de yang rang dbang can gyi thos pa dang ma 'brel ba nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dngos su gzigs @146b pa de yang rang dbang can gyi thos pa dang ma 'brel ba nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: And that direct perception is shown to be independent of learning.

original: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis kyang thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis kyang thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And he has great compassion because he has the nature of great compassion.

original: 'on te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pas kyang ston pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba phyin ci ma log pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pas kyang ston pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the unerring dependent origination taught by the Bodhisattvas, Sravakas, etc.?

original: des na bcom ldan 'das 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the special excellence of the Lord in this regard?

original: smra rnams kyi dam ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smra rnams kyi dam ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúHe is the best of all teachers.‚Äù

original: nyan thos la sogs pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on do teach dependent origination,

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid de dag gi smra rnams kyi dam pa ste gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid de dag gi smra rnams kyi dam pa ste gtso bo yin no //
translated: nevertheless, the Bhagavat is the best, the foremost, of their teachers.

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nyid kyis ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nyid kyis ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the reality of the Dharma himself.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni rang nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni rang nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: For they are not able to teach dependent origination as it has been explained,

original: yon tan dang skyon thams cad 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mthar phyin pa la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon thams cad 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mthar phyin pa la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have not perfected the increase and decrease of all good qualities and faults.

original: bcom ldan 'das kho na mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na mchog yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavat alone is supreme,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: not others,

original: de dag ni de las bzlog pa yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de las bzlog pa yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the opposite of that.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par can du bstan pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par can du bstan pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the perfection of his own aim, which is the characteristic of the abandonment of all the obscurations of the passions and the knowable, together with their instincts.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na bcom ldan 'das ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin na ji ltar de dag las khyad par can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na bcom ldan 'das ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin na ji ltar de dag las khyad par can du 'gyur //
translated: If it were otherwise, if the Lord were not endowed with the qualities as described, how could he be distinguished from the disciples and so on?

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe Omniscient One.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the establishment of omniscience.

original: ci ste de la phyag 'tshal nas ci zhig byed ce na /üîΩde kho na nyid bsdu ba bya //
analyzed: ci ste de la phyag 'tshal nas ci zhig byed ce na / de kho na nyid bsdu ba bya //
translated: If one should ask, ‚ÄúHaving bowed to him, what is to be done?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúI will compose the Compendium of Reality.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na de kho na nyid de /
translated: The reality is just the dependent origination qualified by the distinctions as described.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not erroneous.

original: de dag de dang der rnam par 'thor ba rnams gcig tu sdud pa ni don bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag de dang der rnam par 'thor ba rnams gcig tu sdud pa ni don bsdus pa ste /
translated: The collection of those various topics is the summary of the meaning.

original: don de stan bar byed pa'i phyir gzhung la yang de skad du bstan te /
analyzed: don de stan bar byed pa'i phyir gzhung la yang de skad du bstan te /
translated: The text is so called because it presents that meaning.

original: s'a'i ta phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
analyzed: s'a'i ta phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
translated: It is like a poem that has been stolen from the SƒÅttvata.

original: yang na yang dag par ram kun nas de kho na nyid rnams 'dis sdud par byed pas gzhung nyid la bsdus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yang dag par ram kun nas de kho na nyid rnams 'dis sdud par byed pas gzhung nyid la bsdus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is the text itself that is called ‚Äúsummary‚Äù because it collects together the realities in their entirety or in their entirety.

original: bya zhes bya ba ni @147a * //
analyzed: bya zhes bya ba ni @147a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúshould‚Äù

original: rtsom pa na yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar gyi dus nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rtsom pa na yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar gyi dus nyid bstan to //
translated: indicates the present tense, in reference to the time when the composition is not yet complete.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi bya ba dang bral ba'i de khon nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir grangs can gyi lugs bstan pa'i don du //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi bya ba dang bral ba'i de khon nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir grangs can gyi lugs bstan pa'i don du //
translated: In order to teach the reality that is free from natural activity, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system is presented in order to demonstrate that.üîΩIt is said:

original: nus pa ma lus dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: nus pa ma lus dang ldan pa'i //
translated: Endowed with all abilities,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: ser skya pa rnams na ri chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i tshogs skyed par byed pa'i dbang yid du gyur pa'i nus pa ma lus pa dang rab tu ldan zhing yang dag par ldan pa rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs dag cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs
analyzed: ser skya pa rnams na ri chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i tshogs skyed par byed pa'i dbang yid du gyur pa'i nus pa ma lus pa dang rab tu ldan zhing yang dag par ldan pa rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs dag cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya say: The great one and so on are endowed with and possess in full the power to generate the collection of effects.üîΩüîΩThe state of the parts of sattva, rajas, and tamas being equal is called pradhƒÅna.

original: kyi mtshan nyid can ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: kyi mtshan nyid can ni gtso bo'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya say that the primary nature, which is endowed with and possesses all the powers that generate the collection of effects, such as the great one, is the state of equilibrium of rajas, tamas, and sattva.

original: de dang yid las chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i bye brag de dag 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: de dang yid las chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i bye brag de dag 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: The various effects, such as the great one, arise from that.

original: gtso bo kho na zhes nges bar bzung ba ni skyes bu la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gtso bo kho na zhes nges bar bzung ba ni skyes bu la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly from the primary nature‚Äù is stated to exclude puru·π£a and so on.

original: 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa'i grangs can gyis brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa'i grangs can gyis brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù is stated to exclude ƒ™≈õvara and so on, which are imagined by SƒÅ·πÉkhya who believe in ƒ™≈õvara.

original: rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni dngos sam brgyud pas skyes ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni dngos sam brgyud pas skyes ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarises‚Äù means that it arises directly or indirectly.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi tha snyad ni dang por gtso bo las blo skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi tha snyad ni dang por gtso bo las blo skye'o //
translated: In this way, the conventions of these arise from the intellect, which first arises from the primal substance.

original: blo las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: blo las kyang nga rgyal lo //
translated: From the intellect, the great one arises.üîΩFrom the great one, the I-maker arises.

original: nga rgyal las sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri'i bdag nyid de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal las sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri'i bdag nyid de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: From the I-maker, the five subtle objects of sound, tactility, taste, form, and smell arise, as well as the eleven faculties.

original: blo'i dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: blo'i dbang po lnga ni /
translated: The five faculties of intellect are

original: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: the ear, skin, eye, tongue, and nose.

original: las kyi dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: las kyi dbang po lnga ni /
translated: The five faculties of action are

original: ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms so //
analyzed: ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms so //
translated: speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals.

original: bcu gcig pa ni yid do //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni yid do //
translated: The eleventh is the mind.

original: de tsam lnga las 'byung ba lnga skye ste /
analyzed: de tsam lnga las 'byung ba lnga skye ste /
translated: From the five subtle objects, the five elements arise.

original: sgra las nam ma la 'o //
analyzed: sgra las nam ma la 'o //
translated: From sound, space arises.

original: reg las rlung ngo //
analyzed: reg las rlung ngo //
translated: From tactility, wind arises.

original: gzugs las me'o //üîΩro las chu 'o //
analyzed: gzugs las me'o // ro las chu 'o //
translated: From form, fire arises.üîΩFrom taste, water arises.

original: dri las ni sa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri las ni sa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: From smell, earth arises.

original: ji skad du dbang phyug nag pos /
analyzed: ji skad du dbang phyug nag pos /
translated: As ƒ™≈õvarak·πõ·π£·πáa says,

original: rang bzhin las chen de las nga rgyal te //
analyzed: rang bzhin las chen de las nga rgyal te //
translated: From the primal substance, the great one; from that, the I-maker;

original: de las tshogs ni rnam pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: de las tshogs ni rnam pa bcu drug go //
translated: from that, the collection of sixteen.

original: bcu drug po ni de dag rnams las kyang //
analyzed: bcu drug po ni de dag rnams las kyang //
translated: The sixteen are derived from these.

original: lnga po rnams las 'byung ba chen po lnga //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: lnga po rnams las 'byung ba chen po lnga // zhes bshad do //
translated: From the five are derived the five great elements.

original: de la chen po zhes bya ba ni blo la brjod do //üîΩblo yang 'di bum pa'o //
analyzed: de la chen po zhes bya ba ni blo la brjod do // blo yang 'di bum pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is a designation of the intellect.

original: snam bu'i zhes yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid can no //üîΩnga rgyal ni bdag ni skal ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snam bu'i zhes yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid can no // nga rgyal ni bdag ni skal ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The intellect is the characteristic of the determination of the object, as in ‚Äúthis is a pot,‚Äù ‚Äúthat is a piece of cloth.‚Äù

original: bdag ni lta na sdug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bdag ni lta na sdug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Pride is the characteristic of the conceit ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am fortunate,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am handsome.‚Äù

original: yid ni kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid ni kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mind is the characteristic of imagination.

original: dper na byis ba 'ga' zhig gis grong gzhan na ston mo yod @147b do zhes thos te /
analyzed: dper na byis ba 'ga' zhig gis grong gzhan na ston mo yod @147b do zhes thos te /
translated: For example, a child hears that there is a feast in another village.

original: der bdag 'gro bar bya na ci de na bu ram dang zho yod dam /
analyzed: der bdag 'gro bar bya na ci de na bu ram dang zho yod dam /
translated: He imagines, ‚ÄúI will go there. Are there molasses and curd there?

original: 'on te zho gcig pu yod ces de'i kun tu rtog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rtog pa 'jug pa ni yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te zho gcig pu yod ces de'i kun tu rtog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rtog pa 'jug pa ni yid ces bya'o //
translated: Or is there only curd?‚Äù The engagement of such imagination is called mind.

original: de lta bas na blo dang / nga rgyal dang / yid rnams kyi phan tshun gyi khyad par ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na blo dang / nga rgyal dang / yid rnams kyi phan tshun gyi khyad par ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the difference between the intellect, the great one, and the ego in this way.

original: lhag ma ni go bar bla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar bla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: chen po la sogs pa 'di dag dang / gtso bo dang / skyes bu zhes bya ba 'di dag ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga yin te /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa 'di dag dang / gtso bo dang / skyes bu zhes bya ba 'di dag ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga yin te /
translated: These great ones, etc., and the principal and the person are the twenty-five principles.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid nyi shu lnga shes na //
analyzed: de nyid nyi shu lnga shes na //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving known the twenty-five principles,

original: ral ba'am mgo zlum cod ban can //
analyzed: ral ba'am mgo zlum cod ban can //
translated: whether one has matted hair, a shaven head, or a topknot,

original: gnas ni gang dang gar gnas kyang //üîΩgrol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: gnas ni gang dang gar gnas kyang // grol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: wherever one lives,

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: one is liberated, there is no doubt.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par gtso bo las byung ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas 'dod pa bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams ni rgyu las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par gtso bo las byung ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas 'dod pa bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams ni rgyu las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference in results, as explained, which arises from the principal, is not entirely different from the cause, as the Buddhists, etc., maintain.

original: 'on kyang de ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is of the same nature.

original: gang dag la de'i ste gtso bo'i ngo bo ste bdag nyid yod ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la de'i ste gtso bo'i ngo bo ste bdag nyid yod ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to the nature of the primal substance.

original: yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i ngo bos rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i ngo bos rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the primal substance is the nature of the three qualities, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'bras bu dmigs te dper na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'bras bu dmigs te dper na /
translated: In the world, one observes that the effect has the nature of the cause.

original: snal mnag po dag las byas pa'i snam bu ni nag po dang / dkar po las byas pa ni dkar po yin no //
analyzed: snal mnag po dag las byas pa'i snam bu ni nag po dang / dkar po las byas pa ni dkar po yin no //
translated: For example, a cloth made of black thread is black, and one made of white thread is white.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo dang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pa de ltar blo dang / nga rgyal dang / de tsam dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi gsal ba yang yon tan gsum yin par dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo dang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pa de ltar blo dang / nga rgyal dang / de tsam dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi gsal ba yang yon tan gsum yin par dmigs so //
translated: In the same way, one observes that the intellect, ego, and the manifestation that has the nature of the elements and the senses are the three qualities.

original: de'i phyir de'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, they have the nature of the three qualities.

original: gzhan yang dbye ba med pa ni 'di ltar 'di dag ni snying stobs la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbye ba med pa ni 'di ltar 'di dag ni snying stobs la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the divisions are not different, because one cannot say that these are sattva, etc.,

original: 'di dag ni chen po la sogs pa gsal ba yin no zhes logs shig tu bya bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni chen po la sogs pa gsal ba yin no zhes logs shig tu bya bar mi nus kyi /
translated: and these are the manifestations of mahat, etc.

original: 'on kyang yon tan gang dag yin pa de ni gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang yon tan gang dag yin pa de ni gsal ba yin la /
translated: However, it is said that whatever is a quality is a manifestation,

original: gsal ba gang yin pa de dag ni yon tan rnams yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gang yin pa de dag ni yon tan rnams yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: and whatever is a manifestation is a quality.

original: gzhan yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyi ga yang yul yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyi ga yang yul yin te /
translated: Moreover, both the manifest and the unmanifest are objects,

original: longs spyod par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of what is to be enjoyed.

original: spyi yang yin te /
analyzed: spyi yang yin te /
translated: They are universals,

original: skyes bu thams cad kyi yongs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gyad dang 'bangs mo bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad kyi yongs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gyad dang 'bangs mo bzhin no //
translated: because they are the objects of enjoyment of all beings, like a wrestler and his female counterpart.

original: sems med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin @148a * //
analyzed: sems med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin @148a * //
translated: They are the nature of the nonmental,

original: te ; bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmongs pa lam du bya ba rig bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmongs pa lam du bya ba rig bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the means of knowing pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: skye ba'i chos can yang yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can yang yin te /
translated: They are the phenomena of arising,üîΩbecause they are the means of knowing the arising of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: 'di ltar gtso bos ni blo skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bos ni blo skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, the Lord generates the intellect.

original: blos kyang nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig go //
analyzed: blos kyang nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig go //
translated: And the intellect generates the five subtle elements from the great one, and the eleven organs from the intellect.

original: de tsam gyis 'byung ba chen po skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'byung ba chen po skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The subtle elements generate the great elements.

original: de lta bas na yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug go //
translated: Thus, these effects, which are distinguished by the three qualities, etc., are the nature of that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe three qualities, nondifferentiation, object,

original: yon tan gsum dang dbye ba med yul dang // spyi dang sems med skye ba'i chos can ni //
analyzed: yon tan gsum dang dbye ba med yul dang // spyi dang sems med skye ba'i chos can ni //
translated: universality, nonanimation, and the quality of being born,

original: gsal ba dang ni de bzhin gtso bo ste //
analyzed: gsal ba dang ni de bzhin gtso bo ste //
translated: are the manifest, and likewise the Lord.

original: de bzhin de las bzlog pa'i skyes bu'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin de las bzlog pa'i skyes bu'o // zhes bshad do //
translated: The opposite of that is the soul.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i khyad par de'i ngo bo ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i khyad par de'i ngo bo ma yin nam /
translated: If the effects are not the nature of that,

original: de'i phyir ci ltar bstan bcos su gsal ba dang mi gsal ba mtshan nyid tha dad par brjod /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar bstan bcos su gsal ba dang mi gsal ba mtshan nyid tha dad par brjod /
translated: then how is it that the treatise declares that the manifest and the unmanifest have different characteristics?

original: 'di ltar dbang phyug nag pos /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang phyug nag pos /
translated: As it is said by Isvarakrsna:

original: rgyu ldan mi rtag ma khyab pa //
analyzed: rgyu ldan mi rtag ma khyab pa //
translated: The possessor of cause is impermanent and nonpervasive.

original: byed bcas du ma rten pa ba rtags//üîΩcha shas dang bcas gzhan dbang gsal //
analyzed: byed bcas du ma rten pa ba rtags// cha shas dang bcas gzhan dbang gsal //
translated: The dependent is characterized by the many things that are done.üîΩThe manifest is the dependent that has parts.

original: bzlog pa dag ni mi gsal ba'o //üîΩzhes bstan te /
analyzed: bzlog pa dag ni mi gsal ba'o // zhes bstan te /
translated: The opposite of that is the nonmanifest.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of that passage.

original: gsal ba nyid ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Manifestness is the possession of a cause.

original: 'di ltar gtso bos rgyu dang ldan pa ni blo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bos rgyu dang ldan pa ni blo'o //
translated: Thus, intellect has the primary matter as its cause.

original: blos rgyu dang ldan pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: blos rgyu dang ldan pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Egoity has intellect as its cause.

original: nga rgyal gyis rgyu dang ldan pa ni de tsam lnga dang dbang po bcu gcig go //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis rgyu dang ldan pa ni de tsam lnga dang dbang po bcu gcig go //
translated: The five subtle elements and the eleven faculties have egoity as their cause.

original: de tsam gyis ni 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The gross elements have the subtle elements as their cause.

original: mi gsal ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Nonmanifestness is not like that,

original: de ni gang las kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gang las kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced from anything.

original: de bzhin du gsal ba na mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal ba na mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the manifest is impermanent,

original: skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the quality of being produced.

original: de ltar mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Nonmanifestness is not like that,

original: de ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the quality of being produced.

original: ji ltar gtso bo dang skyes bu de dag ni lha yul dang sa stengs dang / bar snang thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyis 'jug pa de bzhin du gsal ba ni 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo dang skyes bu de dag ni lha yul dang sa stengs dang / bar snang thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyis 'jug pa de bzhin du gsal ba ni 'jug ste /
translated: Just as the primal substance and the self pervade all of the divine realm, the earth, and the intervening space, so too does the manifest.

original: 'on kyang de ni ma khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni ma khyab pa yin no //
translated: But the unmanifest does not pervade.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba'i tshe blo dang / nga rgyal dang / dbang po'i mtshan nyid can byed pa rnam pa bcu gsum dang ldan pa phra ba'i lus la ba rten pa'i gsal ba 'khor ba de bzhin du mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba'i tshe blo dang / nga rgyal dang / dbang po'i mtshan nyid can byed pa rnam pa bcu gsum dang ldan pa phra ba'i lus la ba rten pa'i gsal ba 'khor ba de bzhin du mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the manifest, which is based on the subtle body, is subject to the thirteen transformations of the intellect, the I-maker, and the sense organs, so too is the unmanifest.

original: de ni khyab pa nyid kyis bya ba dang bcas pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyab pa nyid kyis bya ba dang bcas pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the unmanifest is not subject to transformation, because it is not proper that it should be subject to transformation, since it pervades everything.

original: blo dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba rnam pa du ma dmigs la /
analyzed: blo dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba rnam pa du ma dmigs la /
translated: The manifest is perceived to be of many kinds, because of the differences of the intellect, the I-maker, and so on.

original: mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But the unmanifest is not perceived to be of many kinds.

original: de ni gcig nyid du yod pa na 'jig rten @148b gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig nyid du yod pa na 'jig rten @148b gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is one, it is the cause of the three worlds.

original: gsal ba ni rten pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ni rten pa yang yin te /
translated: The manifest is also dependent.

original: gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni de la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For whatever is produced from something is based on that.

original: mi gsal ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the subtle is not like that.

original: de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an effect.

original: gsal ba ni 'gro ba yin te thim par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni 'gro ba yin te thim par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The subtle is a going, because it dissolves.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i dus na 'byung ba rnams ni de tsam la thim mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i dus na 'byung ba rnams ni de tsam la thim mo //
translated: In this way, at the time of destruction, the elements dissolve into that.

original: de tsam ni dbang po lnga'o //üîΩdbang po ni nga rgyal la'o //üîΩnga rgya la ni blo la'o //
analyzed: de tsam ni dbang po lnga'o // dbang po ni nga rgyal la'o // nga rgya la ni blo la'o //
translated: That is the five sense faculties.üîΩThe sense faculties dissolve into the great one.üîΩThe great one dissolves into the intellect.

original: blo ni gtso bo la thim ste /
analyzed: blo ni gtso bo la thim ste /
translated: The intellect dissolves into the principal.

original: mi gsal ba ni de ltar gang la yang thim ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni de ltar gang la yang thim ba ma yin te /
translated: The subtle is not like that, because it does not dissolve into anything.

original: de la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsal ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // gsal ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa yang yin te /
translated: Because it has no cause.

original: sgra dang / reg dang / ro dang / gzugs dang dri'i bdag nyid kyi cha shas rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang / reg dang / ro dang / gzugs dang dri'i bdag nyid kyi cha shas rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subtle is also endowed with parts, because it is endowed with the parts of sound, touch, taste, form and smell.

original: mi gsal ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The subtle is not like that.

original: gtso bo'i bdag nyid la sgra la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i bdag nyid la sgra la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound, etc. are not perceived in the nature of the principal.

original: gzhan yang dper na pha gson ba na bu la rang dbang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gsal ba ni rgyu'i rnam pa thams cad la rag las pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na pha gson ba na bu la rang dbang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gsal ba ni rgyu'i rnam pa thams cad la rag las pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yin no //
translated: Moreover, just as a son is not independent when his father is alive, so manifestation is dependent on all the aspects of the cause, and hence is other-powered.

original: mi gsal ba de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba de lta ma yin te /
translated: That which is not manifest is not so.

original: de ni rtag tu rgyu la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rgyu la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not always dependent on the cause.

original: de lta bas na 'di thams cad dogs par byas nas yang dag tu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di thams cad dogs par byas nas yang dag tu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, having considered all this, he says: in reality.

original: yang dag tu ste /
analyzed: yang dag tu ste /
translated: In reality,

original: don dam par de'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par de'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: it is the reality of that, in the ultimate.

original: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i bye brag gis ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las tha dad pa ji skad du bshad pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i bye brag gis ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las tha dad pa ji skad du bshad pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction in the distinction of transformation from the distinction of intrinsic nature and transformation, as has been explained.

original: yang na yang dag tu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan gsum gyi ngo bos de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag tu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan gsum gyi ngo bos de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Alternatively, in reality means that it is engaged in the reality of that by the intrinsic nature of the nature of the three natures.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa phra ba dang rags pa'i khyad par las chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'khor ba sna tshogs pa 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa phra ba dang rags pa'i khyad par las chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'khor ba sna tshogs pa 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the various transmigrations are not contradictory due to the distinctions of subtle and gross sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod do zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod do zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the thesis: the effect exists in the nature of the cause.

original: de la ji ltar skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod do zhes rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod do zhes rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that the effect exists prior to its arising?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the effect does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag gis 'bras bu yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya pa'i phyir gtan tshigs lnga smras te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'bras bu yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya pa'i phyir gtan tshigs lnga smras te /
translated: Others state five reasons to prove that the effect exists:

original: med pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir dang / thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir dang / nus pa ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir dang / thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir dang / nus pa ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
translated: because what does not exist is not produced, because the cause is grasped, because everything does not arise, because that which is able produces, and because the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: de la gtan tshigs dang po bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di brjod de /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs dang po bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di brjod de /
translated: To prove the first reason, he says this:

original: gal te rgyu yi bdag nyid la //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yi bdag nyid la //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the nature of the cause,üîΩthen how could it arise from that cause?

original: @149a * // 'bras bu nus pa yod min na //
analyzed: @149a * // 'bras bu nus pa yod min na //
translated: In the case of the argument, ‚ÄúIf the effect does not exist in the nature of the cause,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then how could it arise from that cause?,‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu'i bdag nyid la skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du de sus kyang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i bdag nyid la skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du de sus kyang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if the effect does not exist prior to its arising in the nature of the cause, then no one could make it, just like a sky flower.

original: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever does not exist cannot be made by anyone,

original: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.üîΩThe reductio argument is that according to the opponent‚Äôs view, the effect does not exist prior to its arising.

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis kyang 'bras bu ni skyes ba las sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis kyang 'bras bu ni skyes ba las sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is a case of the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case,

original: gang gi phyir til la sogs pas til mar la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhig byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir til la sogs pas til mar la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhig byed de /
translated: because what effect of sesame oil, etc., is made from sesame seeds, etc.?

original: de'i phyir sngar yang yod do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar yang yod do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is established that it existed previously.

original: nus pas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i ngo bos yin gyi /
analyzed: nus pas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i ngo bos yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúability‚Äù refers to the nature of the ability.

original: ser skya pa yang dag gsal ba'i ngo bos ni sngar yod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser skya pa yang dag gsal ba'i ngo bos ni sngar yod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas do not assert that what exists previously is produced again.

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is essenceless means because it is natureless.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa bsgrub pa don du med par mtshungs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa bsgrub pa don du med par mtshungs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The second reason is established by ‚ÄúIf it is similar in being purposeless . . .‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu med pa yin pa de'i tshe skyes bu rnams so sor nges pa'i rgyu ngas len par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu med pa yin pa de'i tshe skyes bu rnams so sor nges pa'i rgyu ngas len par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is without a purpose, then people would not individually take up its causes.

original: 'di ltar s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams s'a lu'i sa bon kho na len par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams s'a lu'i sa bon kho na len par byed kyi /
translated: Thus those who seek rice take up only rice seeds,

original: ko tra pa'i sa bon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ko tra pa'i sa bon ni ma yin no //
translated: not kodrava seeds.

original: de bzhin du bdag sang bram ze la ston mo bya'o snyam nas zho don du gnyer ba 'o ma nyid lan gyi chu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag sang bram ze la ston mo bya'o snyam nas zho don du gnyer ba 'o ma nyid lan gyi chu ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, those who think, ‚ÄúTomorrow I will give a feast for the brahmins,‚Äù take up milk to get yogurt, not water.

original: de la ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag la s'a lu la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du ko tra pa'i sa bon la sogs pa la yang med pa yin pas /üîΩdes na ci'i phyir thams cad du s'a lu'i 'bras bu la sogs pa med par mtshungs na yang so sor nges pa nyid kyi s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa len gyi /
analyzed: de la ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag la s'a lu la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du ko tra pa'i sa bon la sogs pa la yang med pa yin pas / des na ci'i phyir thams cad du s'a lu'i 'bras bu la sogs pa med par mtshungs na yang so sor nges pa nyid kyi s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa len gyi /
translated: Just as rice and so on do not exist in rice seeds and so on, they also do not exist in ko·π≠apaka seeds and so on.üîΩTherefore, why do those who seek rice harvest rice seeds and so on,

original: ko tra pa'i sa bon la sogs pa ni ma yin /
analyzed: ko tra pa'i sa bon la sogs pa ni ma yin /
translated: but not ko·π≠apaka seeds and so on, since rice and so on do not exist in all of them?

original: s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyis ko tra pa la sogs pa yang ci ste len par mi byed de /
analyzed: s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyis ko tra pa la sogs pa yang ci ste len par mi byed de /
translated: Why don‚Äôt those who seek rice harvest ko·π≠apaka seeds and so on?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: ci ste de'i 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyis de dag des len par mi byed pa gal te de lta yin na /
analyzed: ci ste de'i 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyis de dag des len par mi byed pa gal te de lta yin na /
translated: But if they do not harvest them because they are empty of their fruit,

original: s'a lu'i sa bon yang s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer bas len par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon yang s'a lu'i 'bras bu don du gnyer bas len par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then those who seek rice would not harvest rice seeds,

original: ko tra pa'i sa bon bzhin du de'i 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ko tra pa'i sa bon bzhin du de'i 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are empty of their fruit, like ko·π≠apaka seeds.

original: de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so.

original: de lta bas na de la de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, we understand that the effect exists in the cause.

original: gtan tshigs gsum pa bsgrub @149b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum pa bsgrub @149b pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove the third reason,

original: 'di na kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di na kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHere, all things‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang khyod kyi lugs kyis 'bras bu med pa skye'i zhes bya ba yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyi lugs kyis 'bras bu med pa skye'i zhes bya ba yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If, according to your system, an effect that does not exist is produced,

original: rtsva dang / rdul dang / bod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rtsva las gser dngul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsva dang / rdul dang / bod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rtsva las gser dngul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, from all things such as grass, dust, dirt, and so on, all effects such as gold, silver, and so on would be produced.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang bral bar thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang bral bar thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in all things being devoid of the nature of that.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i rtsva la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid bral bar skye ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i rtsva la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid bral bar skye ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: According to your system, all things that possess the nature of being produced, devoid of the nature of the desired things such as grass and so on, are not different. This is the meaning.

original: sngar ni rgyu'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba brjod la /
analyzed: sngar ni rgyu'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba brjod la /
translated: Previously, the consequence was stated from the point of view of the cause;

original: da lta ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
analyzed: da lta ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
translated: now, it is stated from the point of view of the effect. This is the distinction.

original: thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And not everything arises from everything,

original: de'i phyir de nyid la de yod pa yin no zhes bya bar 'di ni nges pa yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid la de yod pa yin no zhes bya bar 'di ni nges pa yin par rtogs so //
translated: therefore, it is ascertained that this is the case: that which exists in reality exists in that.

original: 'di snyam du so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dag la rgyu rnams kyi nus pa nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dag la rgyu rnams kyi nus pa nges pa yin te /
translated: If one thinks that the potency of causes is restricted to specific effects,

original: des na 'bras bu med na yang 'bras bu cung zad cig byed kyi /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu med na yang 'bras bu cung zad cig byed kyi /
translated: then, even when there is no effect, a cause would produce some effect,

original: nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not an effect such as a sky-flower.

original: nus pa gang yin pa'i rgyu cung zad len par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa gang yin pa'i rgyu cung zad len par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: A cause would take on some potency, but not everything.

original: 'ga' zhig nyid 'ga' zhig las skye'i thams cad thams cad las ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i rtsod pa 'di bslang nas lan gdab pa'i zol gyis /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nyid 'ga' zhig las skye'i thams cad thams cad las ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i rtsod pa 'di bslang nas lan gdab pa'i zol gyis /
translated: Some things arise from some things, but not everything from everything.

original: gtan tshigs bzhi pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bzhi pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to respond to this objection, which is raised in order to prove the fourth reason,

original: 'di yi nus pa nges pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di yi nus pa nges pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because the potency of this is ascertained.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to things that are asserted to be causes.

original: de min zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that‚Äù means that the previously mentioned errors do not occur.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i lam de 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i lam de 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: The Buddhist path and so on are not this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rgyu nus pa rnams kyang 'bras bu byed pa na bya bar nus pa nyid byed kyi mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nus pa rnams kyang 'bras bu byed pa na bya bar nus pa nyid byed kyi mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When causes that have potency produce effects, they produce what is capable of being produced, not what is not capable of being produced.

original: 'on te gang gis de khyed cag 'gegs par byed pa mi nus pa kho na byed do zhes bya ba 'di su zhig gis smras /
analyzed: 'on te gang gis de khyed cag 'gegs par byed pa mi nus pa kho na byed do zhes bya ba 'di su zhig gis smras /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúWhat is it that you assert is incapable of being produced?‚Äù

original: 'on te 'bras bu med kyang byed do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu med kyang byed do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven though the effect does not exist, it is produced,‚ÄùüîΩthen that is just so much verbiage.

original: de yang de dag gis bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / khyad par byar med gang yin pa //
analyzed: de yang de dag gis bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhe na / de'i phyir / khyad par byar med gang yin pa //
translated: And that also is incapable of being produced.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, ‚ÄúWhat is incapable of being produced‚Äù and so on is said.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩkhyed kyis 'bras bu med pa byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyis @150a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te / khyed kyis 'bras bu med pa byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyis @150a * //
translated: He thinks this:üîΩYou have accepted that it is an activity that is without an effect.

original: bya bar mi nus pa byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bya bar mi nus pa byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: By that very fact, you have taught that it is an activity that is not able to be done.

original: 'di ltar gang med pa de ni ngo bo med pa rang bzhin med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang med pa de ni ngo bo med pa rang bzhin med pa yin la /
translated: In that case, what does not exist is without an essence, without a nature.

original: gang ngo bo med pa de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par byar med cing khyad par bsgrub tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang ngo bo med pa de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par byar med cing khyad par bsgrub tu med pa yin no //
translated: What is without an essence is like the horn of a rabbit, etc., and is not to be distinguished, is not to be established as a distinction.

original: gang yang khyad par bsgrub tu med pa de ni nam mkha' bzhin du mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang khyad par bsgrub tu med pa de ni nam mkha' bzhin du mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: What is not to be established as a distinction is, like space, unchanging.

original: khyad par gyi rang bzhin bsgrub tu med pa lta bu de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis bya bar nus /
analyzed: khyad par gyi rang bzhin bsgrub tu med pa lta bu de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis bya bar nus /
translated: How can anyone be able to do what is like the establishment of a distinction that is not a nature?

original: ci ste yang de ni yod pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang de ni yod pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is just because it has attained the state of existence that it is changing,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says,

original: de'i phyir / 'gyur ba bdag nyid nyams 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gyur ba bdag nyid nyams 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the nature of change would be impaired,

original: gang gi phyir rnam par 'gyur bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa zhes bya bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par 'gyur bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa zhes bya bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because whatever is asserted to be transformation is said to be ‚Äúwithout an intrinsic reality of its own.‚Äù

original: de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be destroyed.

original: med pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa yin na yod pa'i ngo bo thob par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa yin na yod pa'i ngo bo thob par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: If it were not to abandon its intrinsic reality of nonexistence, it would not be reasonable for it to attain an existent intrinsic reality.

original: yongs su btang na yang 'on ni med pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa'i ngo bo thob po zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su btang na yang 'on ni med pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa'i ngo bo thob po zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were to abandon it, then it would not be established that ‚Äúwhat is nonexistent attains an existent intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: yod pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: yod pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan yin la /
translated: An existent intrinsic reality is one thing,

original: med pa'i ngo bo yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo yang gzhan yin te /
translated: and a nonexistent intrinsic reality is another.

original: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive.

original: de lta bas na gang med pa de bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang med pa de bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is nonexistent is not capable of being produced.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po byed pa nyid khas blangs pa yin na ni rgyu rnams mi nus pa byed pa nyid kho nar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po byed pa nyid khas blangs pa yin na ni rgyu rnams mi nus pa byed pa nyid kho nar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that a thing that is such that it is produced is capable of being produced, then you accept that causes are only capable of producing what is incapable of being produced.

original: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du gang gis kyang mi nus pa bya ba yang ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du gang gis kyang mi nus pa bya ba yang ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not possible for anything to be produced, just like a sky flower.

original: de'i phyir nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni lan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni lan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the capacity is individually distinct, this is not an answer.

original: gtan tshigs lnga pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩde ltar 'bras bu mi rung phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs lnga pa bsgrub pa'i phyir / de ltar 'bras bu mi rung phyir //
translated: In order to prove the fifth reason,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, because the effect is not tenable,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas sam /
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas sam /
translated: Thus, by the reasoning just explained,üîΩor by all four of the previously explained reasons, for the proponent of the nonexistence of the effect, in every way the effect is not tenable.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bzhi kas 'bras bu med par smra ba la rnam pa thams cad du 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir ci zhig byed pa na sa bon la sogs pa rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bzhi kas 'bras bu med par smra ba la rnam pa thams cad du 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir ci zhig byed pa na sa bon la sogs pa rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, what function would the seed and so on perform as a cause?

original: de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the seed and so on are not the cause,üîΩbecause the effect does not exist, just like a sky flower.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no zhes de skad du brjod par nus na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no zhes de skad du brjod par nus na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: If you are able to say this, then it is not so.

original: de'i phyir skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod do zhes bzlog pas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa las sngar 'bras bu yod do zhes bzlog pas grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established by the reversal of the statement, ‚ÄúThe effect exists prior to its arising.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gal te 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya @150b bar grub na yang 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag gtso bo nyid las rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya @150b bar grub na yang 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag gtso bo nyid las rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: If you think that although the statement ‚ÄúThe effect exists‚Äù is established, how could the statement ‚ÄúThese effects arise from the primal substance‚Äù be established?

original: gsal ba 'di ni bde sogs kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal ba 'di ni bde sogs kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The clear manifestation of pleasure and so onüîΩis the effect of the primal substance.

original: de la gtso bo yod pa nyid du sgrub pa la ldan pa'i sbyor ba lnga smras te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo yod pa nyid du sgrub pa la ldan pa'i sbyor ba lnga smras te /
translated: In order to prove that the primal substance exists, five syllogisms are stated.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: khyad par tshad phyir rjes 'gro'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par tshad phyir rjes 'gro'i phyir //
translated: Because of the measure of the effect, because of the conformity,

original: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: because of the engagement through the capacity,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer yod phyir //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer yod phyir //
translated: because of the distinction between cause and effect,

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med phyir //
translated: because of the indivisibility of the variety of natures,

original: mi gsal ba yi rgyu yod do //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba yi rgyu yod do // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: the cause of the unclear exists.

original: don 'di yin te /üîΩgtso bo yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te / gtso bo yod pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: khyad par rnams la tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams la tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The primal substance exists because the effects have a measure.

original: 'jig rten 'di na gang la byed pa po yod pa de la tshad yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na gang la byed pa po yod pa de la tshad yod par mthong ste /
translated: In this world, whatever is the product of an agent is seen to have a measure.

original: dper na rdza mkhan dang ldan pas 'jim gong las bre lnga shong ba dang / bre do shong ba dang / bre bcu shong ba'i tshad dang ldan pa'i bum pa byed pa bzhin no //
