analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan dang ldan pas 'jim gong las bre lnga shong ba dang / bre do shong ba dang / bre bcu shong ba'i tshad dang ldan pa'i bum pa byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a potter makes a pot that has a measure of five drona, two drona, or ten drona, in accordance with the size of the lump of clay.

original: chen po la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'di yang blo gcig dang / nga rgyal gcig dang / de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig dang / 'byung ba lnga zhes bya ba'i tshad dang ldan par mthong ngo //
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'di yang blo gcig dang / nga rgyal gcig dang / de tsam lnga dang / dbang po bcu gcig dang / 'byung ba lnga zhes bya ba'i tshad dang ldan par mthong ngo //
translated: And this manifestation, such as the great one, is seen to have a measure in accordance with one cognition, one pride, five of those, eleven organs, and five elements.

original: de'i phyir gang las tshad dang ldan pa'i gsal ba skye bar byed pa'i gtso bo yod par rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las tshad dang ldan pa'i gsal ba skye bar byed pa'i gtso bo yod par rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be established by inference that the primal substance exists, from which the manifestation with a measure arises.

original: gal te yang gtso bo med na gsal ba 'di tshad dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang gtso bo med na gsal ba 'di tshad dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the primal substance did not exist, this manifestation would not have a measure.

original: 'di las kyang gtso bo yod de /
analyzed: 'di las kyang gtso bo yod de /
translated: The primal substance exists because of this,

original: khyad par rnams rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the distinctions are seen to follow.

original: gang rigs dang ldan par dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang rigs dang ldan par dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: That which is observed to possess a certain nature arises from a cause that is of that nature.

original: dper na bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i khyad par 'jim pa'i rigs dang ldan pa de dag ni 'ji ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i khyad par 'jim pa'i rigs dang ldan pa de dag ni 'ji ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the specific features of a pot, a dish, etc., which are observed to possess the nature of clay, arise from a cause that is of the nature of clay.

original: gsal ba'i khyad par 'di yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang ldan par dmigs so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i khyad par 'di yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang ldan par dmigs so //
translated: This specific manifestation is observed to possess the nature of pleasure, pain, delusion, etc.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rab tu dang ba dang / gdung pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba dang / gdung pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the results of clarity, agitation, and depression, etc., are observed.

original: 'di ltar snying stobs kyi 'bras bu ni rab tu dang ba dang / yang ba dang / zhen pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dga' ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying stobs kyi 'bras bu ni rab tu dang ba dang / yang ba dang / zhen pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dga' ba rnams yin no //
translated: Thus, the results of sattva are clarity, lightness, attachment, increase, and joy.

original: bde ba zhes bya bas kyang snying stobs nyid brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya bas kyang snying stobs nyid brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúpleasure‚Äù also expresses sattva.

original: rdul gyi 'bras bu ni gdung ba dang / skem pa dang / tha dad pa dang / rengs pa dang / skyo ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rdul gyi 'bras bu ni gdung ba dang / skem pa dang / tha dad pa dang / rengs pa dang / skyo ba rnams yin no //
translated: The result of rajas is pain, emaciation, differentiation, rigidity, and fatigue.

original: rdul yang sdug bsngal gyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: rdul yang sdug bsngal gyi sgras brjod do //
translated: Rajas is also expressed by the word ‚Äúsuffering.‚Äù

original: mun pa'i 'bras bu ni zhum pa dang / sgrib pa dang / sdom pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / lci ba rnams yin no //üîΩmun pa yang rmongs pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: mun pa'i 'bras bu ni zhum pa dang / sgrib pa dang / sdom pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / lci ba rnams yin no // mun pa yang rmongs pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The result of tamas is depression, obscuration, bondage, violence, and heaviness.

original: chen po @151a * //
analyzed: chen po @151a * //
translated: Tamas is also expressed by the word ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu rab tu dang ba dang / gdung ba dang yang ba la sogs pa dmigs so //
analyzed: la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu rab tu dang ba dang / gdung ba dang yang ba la sogs pa dmigs so //
translated: The result of all of these, beginning with sattva, is clarity, pain, lightness, and so on.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmongs pa rnam pa gsum po rnams kyi gnas lugs kyi khyad par yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmongs pa rnam pa gsum po rnams kyi gnas lugs kyi khyad par yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is the specific nature of the three kinds of happiness, suffering, and ignorance.

original: des na 'di dag ni rab tu dang pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du grub cing de'i rjes su 'gro ba las kyang de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las byung ba nyid grub po //
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni rab tu dang pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du grub cing de'i rjes su 'gro ba las kyang de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las byung ba nyid grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that pleasure, etc. are possessed by virtue of the result of clear faith, etc. and it is established that they arise from a nature that is their intrinsic reality by the concomitance of that.

original: de grub pa na yang shugs kyis rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gtso bo yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de grub pa na yang shugs kyis rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gtso bo yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: And when that is established, then it is established by implication that whatever is the intrinsic reality is the principal.

original: gtso bo yod na tha dad pa dag rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yod na tha dad pa dag rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the principal exists, it is seen that the different things are concomitant with it.

original: 'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin te /
translated: And from this also, the principal exists.

original: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin no //
translated: Because of engagement by way of potentiality.

original: 'jig rten 'di na gang zhig don gang la 'jug pa de ni de la nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na gang zhig don gang la 'jug pa de ni de la nus pa yin te /
translated: Whatever engages in whatever object here in the world, that is the potentiality of that.

original: dper na thag pa snam bu byed pa la 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na thag pa snam bu byed pa la 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a rope engages in the activity of making a mat.

original: de'i phyir gang gis gsal ba skyed par byed pa'i gtso bo'i nus pa yod do zhes bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis gsal ba skyed par byed pa'i gtso bo'i nus pa yod do zhes bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be established that the primal substance has the power to produce the manifest.

original: nus pa de yang rten med pa can ma yin te //
analyzed: nus pa de yang rten med pa can ma yin te //
translated: And that power is not without a basis.

original: de'i phyir gang la nus pa 'jug par byed pa'i gtso bo yod do //üîΩ'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la nus pa 'jug par byed pa'i gtso bo yod do // 'di las kyang gtso bo yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the primal substance exists, which is the basis of the power.üîΩAlso, the primal substance exists because of the distinction between cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dbyer yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rnam par dbye ba mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dbyer yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rnam par dbye ba mthong ste /
translated: In this world, the distinction between cause and effect is seen.

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu ni rgyu yin la bum pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu ni rgyu yin la bum pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For example, the lump of clay is the cause and the pot is the effect.

original: de yang 'ji ba'i gong bu las tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'ji ba'i gong bu las tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: And that is a nature different from the lump of clay.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin par nus kyi /
translated: For in this way, the pot is able to hold honey, water, and milk,

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu ni ma yin no //
translated: but the lump of clay is not.

original: de ltar na chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di mthong nas gang las chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gtso bo yod do zhes bsgrub bo //üîΩ'di las kyang gtso bo yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di mthong nas gang las chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gtso bo yod do zhes bsgrub bo // 'di las kyang gtso bo yod de /
translated: Thus, having seen this effect, namely, the great one, etc., one should establish that the primal substance exists, which is the cause that generates this effect, namely, the great one, etc.

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The primal substance exists because of the non-differentiation of the various natures.

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum la brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum la brjod do //
translated: The various natures are said to be the three worlds.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig pa'i dus na 'ga' zhig tu dbyer med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig pa'i dus na 'ga' zhig tu dbyer med par 'gyur te /
translated: At the time of dissolution, these are not differentiated in any way.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba lnga ni de tsam lnga la dbyer med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde tsam dang / dbang po dag ni nga rgyal la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba lnga ni de tsam lnga la dbyer med par 'gyur ro // de tsam dang / dbang po dag ni nga rgyal la /
translated: Thus, the five elements are not differentiated in the five subtle elements.

original: nga rgyal ni blo la //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni blo la //
translated: The subtle elements and the senses are not differentiated in the great one.üîΩThe great one is not differentiated in the intellect.

original: blo ni gtso bo la dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo ni gtso bo la dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The intellect is not differentiated in the primal substance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na 'jig pa'i dus su 'jig rten gsum dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na 'jig pa'i dus su 'jig rten gsum dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, at the time of dissolution, the three worlds are not differentiated.

original: dbyer med par zhes bya ba ni @151b rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med par zhes bya ba ni @151b rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Not differentiated means not capable of being distinguished.

original: de lta bas na gang du chen po la sogs pa zhum par dbyer med par 'gro ba'i gtso bo yod pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang du chen po la sogs pa zhum par dbyer med par 'gro ba'i gtso bo yod pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the primal substance exists, which is the cause of the evolution of the great one, etc.

original: de lta bas na 'dir slob dpon gyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes lhag ma rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i don du gtan tshigs kho na bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir slob dpon gyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes lhag ma rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i don du gtan tshigs kho na bstan to //
translated: Therefore, here the master has taught only the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the relation, ‚Äù in order to illustrate the rest.

original: de la bde sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal dang rmongs pa gnyis gzung ngo //
analyzed: de la bde sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal dang rmongs pa gnyis gzung ngo //
translated: In this regard, the words ‚Äúpleasure, etc. ‚Äù include both pain and delusion.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Manifestation‚Äù refers to the great one, etc., up to the final evolvent.

original: gsal bar snang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal bar snang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Manifestation appears‚Äù means ‚Äúmanifestation is perceived. ‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom the refinement, etc. ‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgra re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be construed with each of the terms.

original: 'di ni kho bo cag gis dang po nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gis dang po nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained by us at the very outset.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the proof of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being a subsequent goer,‚Äù

original: tshad ma dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to set forth the valid cognition,

original: de bas de rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas de rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚ÄúTherefore, it is of that type,‚Äù and so on.

original: de rigs rjes 'gro mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rigs rjes 'gro mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen to be a subsequent goer of that type.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: This is the reason.

original: yon tan gsum gyi mtshan nyid de nyid kyi rigs rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi mtshan nyid de nyid kyi rigs rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is seen to be a subsequent goer of that reality which is characterized by the three qualities.

original: de'i dngos las byung zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de las byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dngos las byung zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de las byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Arisen from its entity means arisen from the cause of the entity of pleasure and so on.

original: 'dis kyang bsgrub bya bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bsgrub bya bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the probandum.

original: bum sogs bye brag bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: bum sogs bye brag bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: Like the particularities of pot and so on means like the particularities of pot and so on.üîΩWhatever is the cause of its nature is the principal.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni gtso bo yin no zhes ser skya pa ste grangs can rnams smra bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni gtso bo yin no zhes ser skya pa ste grangs can rnams smra bar byed do //
translated: This is what Kapila, that is, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, says.

original: de phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the response to that is, ‚ÄúTherefore, this is not so.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig gtso bo kho na las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag de'i ngo bor rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gtso bo kho na las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag de'i ngo bor rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: In response to the assertion, ‚ÄúThese various effects arise from the nature of the primal substance,‚Äù this should be analyzed:

original: gal te 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag gtso bo'i rang bzhin kho na yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag la 'bras bu nyid du 'jug par 'gyur /üîΩgang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i khyad par 'di dag gtso bo'i rang bzhin kho na yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag la 'bras bu nyid du 'jug par 'gyur / gang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: If these various effects are the nature of the primal substance, then how could they be effects?

original: rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that something that is not different from something else is its effect or cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is because causes and effects have different characteristics.

original: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i ma 'dres pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa byas pa gang yin par 'ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i ma 'dres pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa byas pa gang yin par 'ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that were not so, then how could one make the unmixed presentation, ‚ÄúThis is an effect,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis is a cause‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir khyed cag gis rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag gis rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, your presentation of the root nature as only a cause and

original: 'byung ba dang dbang po'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs bcu drug ni 'bras bu kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang dbang po'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs bcu drug ni 'bras bu kho na yin zhing /
translated: the collection of sixteen, which has the characteristics of the great elements and faculties, as only an effect,

original: blo dang / nga rgyal dang / @152a * //
analyzed: blo dang / nga rgyal dang / @152a * //
translated: and your presentation of intellect, ego,

original: de tsam rnams ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos na rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa byas pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam rnams ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos na rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa byas pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the five sense objects as both cause and effect, depending on whether they are earlier or later, would not be tenable.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba min //
translated: The root nature is unchanging.

original: chen po sogs bdun rang bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: chen po sogs bdun rang bzhin 'gyur //
translated: The seven, the great and so on, are changing.

original: bcu drug po rnams 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: bcu drug po rnams 'gyur pa ste //
translated: The sixteen are also changing.

original: skyes bu rang bzhin 'gyur ba min //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu rang bzhin 'gyur ba min // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The person is unchanging.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad rgyu 'am 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad rgyu 'am 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the person is not different from the aggregates, it follows that all are either cause or effect because they are not mutually different.

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni ltos ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ltos par bya ba ngo bo gzhan yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni ltos ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ltos par bya ba ngo bo gzhan yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the entities of cause and effect are dependent, and since it is impossible for that which is dependent to have a different nature,

original: skyes bu bzhin du thams cad rang bzhin yang ma yin la 'gyur ba yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu bzhin du thams cad rang bzhin yang ma yin la 'gyur ba yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: like a person, all things would not be natural nor would they change.

original: gzhan du na skyes bu yang rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i tha snyad du bya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩzho gang yin pa de 'om //
analyzed: gzhan du na skyes bu yang rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i tha snyad du bya bar 'gyur ro // zho gang yin pa de 'om //
translated: Otherwise, even a person would be designated as natural and changing.üîΩWhatever is milk, that is curd.

original: 'o ma gang yin de zho zhes //
analyzed: 'o ma gang yin de zho zhes //
translated: Whatever is curd, that is milk.

original: drag po len gyis bstan pa ste //
analyzed: drag po len gyis bstan pa ste //
translated: This is the teaching of Draviamiitra,

original: de bzhin 'bigs byed gnas pa'ang 'chad //üîΩces bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin 'bigs byed gnas pa'ang 'chad // ces bshad do //
translated: and also of the one who lives in the Vindhyas.

original: yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan ni gsal ba yin la //
analyzed: yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan ni gsal ba yin la //
translated: Moreover, whatever is said about the manifestation of things that possess attributes such as possessing a cause,

original: bzlog pa ni mi gsal ba yin no zhes gang yin brjod pa de yang byis pa'i tshig nyid yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mi gsal ba yin no zhes gang yin brjod pa de yang byis pa'i tshig nyid yin te /
translated: and the nonmanifestation of things that are the opposite of that, is the mere prattle of fools.

original: gang zhig gang las rang bzhin tha mi dad pa de ni de las bzlog par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las rang bzhin tha mi dad pa de ni de las bzlog par mi rigs te /
translated: That which is not essentially different from something else cannot be different from it.

original: bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of difference is having a different nature.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the convention of difference would be cut off.

original: de'i phyir rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams dang / sems can rnams phan tshun tha dad par khas blangs pa rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar 'gyur ba dang ; sna tshogs pa thams cad ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams dang / sems can rnams phan tshun tha dad par khas blangs pa rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar 'gyur ba dang ; sna tshogs pa thams cad ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be utterly causeless to accept that atoms, darkness, and sattva, and sentient beings are mutually different, and everything that is manifold would have a single nature.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that they would be simultaneously produced and destroyed.

original: tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of being established as not different is having the same pleasure and pain.

original: de lta bas na gsal ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yang gsal ba'i ngo bo bzhin du rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gsal ba yang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir rgyu dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yang gsal ba'i ngo bo bzhin du rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gsal ba yang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir rgyu dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the manifest is not different from the nature of the unmanifest, it would possess the attributes of not possessing a cause, and so on.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is ascertained just like its own nature.

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar @152b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar @152b 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a great fallacy.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa rtogs na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa rtogs na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub kyi /
translated: Moreover, in the world, when the definite concomitance and the definite counter-pervasion are understood, the relation of cause and effect is established.

original: gang gis gtso bo las chen po dang / chen po las nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba gtso bo la sogs pa las chen po la sogs ba skye bar nges pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rtogs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gtso bo las chen po dang / chen po las nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba gtso bo la sogs pa las chen po la sogs ba skye bar nges pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rtogs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is certain that mahat and so on arise from prakriti and so on, because there is no evidence whatsoever for the existence of a relationship between them, such as the invariable concomitance of their presence and absence.

original: de'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa las chen po la sogs ba skye ba'i tha snyad 'di ni rgyu mtshan med pa kho na'o //üîΩgang gis gtso bo las 'bras bu'i khyad par skyed pa nyid du 'grub bar 'gyur ba rtag pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa las chen po la sogs ba skye ba'i tha snyad 'di ni rgyu mtshan med pa kho na'o // gang gis gtso bo las 'bras bu'i khyad par skyed pa nyid du 'grub bar 'gyur ba rtag pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the convention that mahat and so on arise from prakriti and so on is completely groundless.üîΩFor a permanent thing, the state of being a cause is not tenable, because it is established that a permanent thing is not a cause.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is contradictory for a permanent thing to be a cause, because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to be functional either intermittently or non-intermittently.

original: 'di snyam du gang gis ngo bo tha dad med ba na de 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho bo cag ni snga na med pa'i rang bzhin skye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis ngo bo tha dad med ba na de 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho bo cag ni snga na med pa'i rang bzhin skye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'dod de /
translated: But we do not accept that the nature of the effect is not different from the cause, because we do not accept that the effect arises from a cause that is not previously existent.

original: gang gi phyir gtso bo sprul 'khyil pa la sogs pa bzhin du chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur bar 'gro bas chen po la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bstan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtso bo sprul 'khyil pa la sogs pa bzhin du chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur bar 'gro bas chen po la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bstan la /
translated: Because the cause, prakriti, transforms into the nature of mahat and so on, like a coiled snake uncoils, it is taught that it is the cause of mahat and so on.

original: chen po la sogs pa de dag kyang gtso bo de yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa de dag kyang gtso bo de yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
translated: And because mahat and so on are the transformed nature of prakriti, they are taught to be its effects.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba yang dngos po gcig la gnas pa'i phyir tha mi dad kyang 'gal ba med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba yang dngos po gcig la gnas pa'i phyir tha mi dad kyang 'gal ba med do snyam du sems na /
translated: Since transformation is based on a single entity, there is no contradiction, even though they are not different.

original: de ni yang dag ba ma yin te yongs su 'gyur ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yang dag ba ma yin te yongs su 'gyur ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not correct because transformation is not established.

original: 'di ltar yongs su 'gyur ba na snga ma'i ngo bo yongs su dor nas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su 'gyur ba na snga ma'i ngo bo yongs su dor nas sam /
translated: If it transforms, it does so by either abandoning its previous nature or not.

original: yongs su ma dor bar yin grang /
analyzed: yongs su ma dor bar yin grang /
translated: But if it is not relinquished,

original: gal te ma dor bar yin na de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma dor bar yin na de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time there would be a confused state,

original: rgan po nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang long tsho nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgan po nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang long tsho nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even in the state of being old and so on, the states of being young and so on would be observed.

original: 'on te yongs su dor nas yin na de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo las nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yongs su dor nas yin na de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo las nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is relinquished, then it follows that it would degenerate from its own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan snga ma 'gag cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan snga ma 'gag cing /
translated: Therefore, since a previous nature ceases and

original: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: a different nature that did not exist previously arises,

original: yongs su gyur pa 'ga' yang i 'grub bo //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa 'ga' yang i 'grub bo //
translated: no transformation at all is established.

original: gzhan yang yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar brjod la /
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of transformation is said to be the transformation of that into something else.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang phyogs gcig gis sam /üîΩbdag @153a * //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang phyogs gcig gis sam / bdag @153a * //
translated: But that transformation is either a transformation by one part

original: nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur ba yin grang /
analyzed: nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur ba yin grang /
translated: or a transformation by one‚Äôs whole self.

original: re zhig phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by one part.

original: gcig la phyogs gcig mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la phyogs gcig mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for one part of a thing to be different from another part of that same thing.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that the whole of it is different,

original: don gzhan skye ba na snga ma 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan skye ba na snga ma 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that when a different object is produced, the former one would be destroyed.

original: de lta bas na de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus it is not logical that it itself becomes different,

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for that is the production of a different nature.

original: ci ste yang chos can rnam par gnas pa la chos gzhan log pas chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang chos can rnam par gnas pa la chos gzhan log pas chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur bar brjod kyi /
translated: But if you think that when a different attribute is produced in a persisting entity, that is called transformation,

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and it is not the case that its nature becomes different,

original: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: then this is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos de chos can las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos de chos can las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig gam /
translated: In this regard, is that attribute that is engaged and disengaged from the entity different from the entity or not different from it?

original: don gzhan du ma gyur pa zhig yin gal te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: don gzhan du ma gyur pa zhig yin gal te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If it is different from it, then

original: chos can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya /
analyzed: chos can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya /
translated: How can it be said that it is transformed, since it is the very same state of the thing?

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i snam bu dang rta dag skye ba dang 'jig pa na g-yo ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i bum pa la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i snam bu dang rta dag skye ba dang 'jig pa na g-yo ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i bum pa la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A cloth and a horse, which are different things, do not transform into a pot, whose nature is not mobile, when they are produced and destroyed.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For that would be absurd.

original: de lta na skyes bu yang yongs su 'gyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na skyes bu yang yongs su 'gyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, a person would transform.

original: gal te de dang 'brel pa'i chos gnyis skye ba dang 'jig pas de yongs su 'gyur bar gzhag gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel pa'i chos gnyis skye ba dang 'jig pas de yongs su 'gyur bar gzhag gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the two properties that are related to it that are produced and destroyed, and that it is on that account that it is said to transform, not in any other way,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'brel pa med na de dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar 'brel par 'gyur na yod pa la 'am /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'brel pa med na de dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'brel par 'gyur na yod pa la 'am /
translated: For if existence and nonexistence are not related, then it is not established that it is related to them.

original: med pa la yin grang /
analyzed: med pa la yin grang /
translated: If it is related in this way, is it related to an existent or to a nonexistent?

original: re zhig yod pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not related to an existent.

original: de ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa thob pas ltos pa med pa nyid kyis 'ga' la yang rag las par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa thob pas ltos pa med pa nyid kyis 'ga' la yang rag las par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that it is dependent on anything, since it is independent, having obtained all of the excellent natures.

original: med pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it nonexistent,

original: de ni nye bar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba yin pa nyid kyis 'ga' la yang brten pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nye bar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba yin pa nyid kyis 'ga' la yang brten pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that it is dependent on anything, since it is devoid of all characteristics of expression.

original: gang gi phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ni 'ga' la yang brten par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ni 'ga' la yang brten par mi rigs so //
translated: Because it is not tenable that horns of a rabbit and so on are dependent on anything.

original: chos gzhan tha dad pa skye ba dang 'jig pa na khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par 'jog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan tha dad pa skye ba dang 'jig pa na khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par 'jog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that you posit transformation in other phenomena that arise and are destroyed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gang la gnas skabs tha dad kyang bdag @153b nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa na de la khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: gang la gnas skabs tha dad kyang bdag @153b nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa na de la khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag la /
translated: You posit transformation in that which, although its states are different, is a single nature that is a single intrinsic reality that continues.

original: chos can las chos dag tha dad pa na rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can las chos dag tha dad pa na rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If the properties are different from the subject, then they cannot be included in the same single nature.

original: de dag gi gcig gi bdag nyid ni chos can nyid yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi gcig gi bdag nyid ni chos can nyid yin la /
translated: The nature of the subject is one of the properties.

original: chos las de yang tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos las de yang tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is different from the properties,

original: rang bzhin gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not included in the same single nature.

original: 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i chos gnyis las tha dad pa'i chos can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mthong ba'i lam du 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir de 'dra ba ni mkhas pa rnams kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i chos gnyis las tha dad pa'i chos can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mthong ba'i lam du 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir de 'dra ba ni mkhas pa rnams kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid yin no //
translated: Since there is no subject that is observed to have the characteristics of engaging and disengaging, which are different from the properties, the wise do not accept that such a subject is the object of a nonimplicative negation.

original: ci ste don gzhan du ma gyur pa'i phyogs yin pa de lta na yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i chos gnyis kyang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan du ma gyur pa'i phyogs yin pa de lta na yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i chos gnyis kyang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid
translated: Even if the subject were not a different object, since it would not be different from the single nature of the subject, the two properties of arising and ceasing would also be one, just like the nature of the subject.

original: yin pa'i phyir gang zhig la brten nas chos can nam chos su 'gyur pa yin /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir gang zhig la brten nas chos can nam chos su 'gyur pa yin /
translated: Therefore, what is the basis of the existence of the subject or of the attribute?

original: chos gnyis chos can gyi gnas skabs can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnas skabs can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ldog pa yang med /
analyzed: chos gnyis chos can gyi gnas skabs can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnas skabs can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ldog pa yang med /
translated: Since the two attributes are not different from the state of the subject, there is no distinction, just as there is no distinction in the intrinsic reality of the state.

original: skye ba yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba yang med do //
translated: Nor is there origination.

original: chos gnyis las chos can gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du snga na med pa skye zhing snga ma 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir gcig 'ga' yang yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: chos gnyis las chos can gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du snga na med pa skye zhing snga ma 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir gcig 'ga' yang yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'grub po //
translated: Since the subject is not different from the two attributes, just as there is no intrinsic reality of the attribute that did not exist previously and that is originated and destroyed, it is not established that anything whatsoever is transformed.

original: de'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba'i dbang gis kyang khyed cag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba'i dbang gis kyang khyed cag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the convention of cause and effect is not reasonable for you even by way of transformation.

original: skyon 'di ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de yal bar dor nas 'bras bu med par smra ba'i skyon gzhan gyis smras pa gang yin pa 'di de la yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de yal bar dor nas 'bras bu med par smra ba'i skyon gzhan gyis smras pa gang yin pa 'di de la yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Since this fault is obvious, having set it aside, we think that later on we will explain the other faults that the opponent who advocates the nonexistence of effects will have to face.

original: skyon mtshungs par bstan pa'i zol gyis /
analyzed: skyon mtshungs par bstan pa'i zol gyis /
translated: With the pretense of teaching the equivalence of the faults,

original: re zhig 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: he refutes the position that the effect exists.

original: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúTherefore, in this regard,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo bzangs rnams zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa pa'o //
analyzed: blo bzangs rnams zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise‚Äù refers to the followers of the Sugata.

original: de dag gis smras pa'i med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa lnga byas pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa la yang ste /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa'i med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa lnga byas pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa la yang ste /
translated: The five arguments that they have presented, beginning with ‚ÄúBecause they do not make that which does not exist arise,‚Äù are equivalent in the case of existence.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra pa'i phyogs la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra pa'i phyogs la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: They are equivalent in the case of the position that the effect exists.

original: 'di ltar 'di la 'di skad du brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la 'di skad du brjod par nus te /
translated: In this regard, the following can be said.

original: yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir dang / thams @154a * //
analyzed: yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir dang / thams @154a * //
translated: Because it does not make what exists, because it takes up causes, and because it is the support of the three realms.

original: cad skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / nus pas ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cad skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / nus pas ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: because what exists is not produced, because the cause is taken up, because everything is unproduced, because the potential produces the potential, and because the effect exists when the cause exists.

original: gang na yod pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes par du chod pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang na yod pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes par du chod pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The effect that exists when the cause exists does not exist in the cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga'i skyon gang yin pa de gcig la klan kar rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga'i skyon gang yin pa de gcig la klan kar rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because what exists is not produced, because the cause is taken up, and so on. The fault of both reasons is not proper to be a fault of one.

original: 'on te 'dir med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtsod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtsod pa yin la /
translated: But if the argument here is that the effect does not exist in the cause because what does not exist is not produced,

original: gzhan du yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtsod pa 'di ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan du yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtsod pa 'di ma yin nam /
translated: is the argument not that the effect does not exist in the cause because what exists is not produced?

original: ji ltar 'di mtshungs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mtshungs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this similar?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not.

original: bsam pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thought is not fully understood.

original: mi byed pa dang / nges pa'i rgyu len pa la sogs pa tsam brjod par 'dod nas 'di brjod la /
analyzed: mi byed pa dang / nges pa'i rgyu len pa la sogs pa tsam brjod par 'dod nas 'di brjod la /
translated: If you assert that the mere taking up of the cause of non-activity, etc. is stated,

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba la yang mi byed pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba la yang mi byed pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the result exists, because non-activity, etc. are the same.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba khyed cag gi rtsod pa'i len gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu med par smra ba blo bzangs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba khyed cag gi rtsod pa'i len gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu med par smra ba blo bzangs te /
translated: The taking up of the dispute of you who assert the result is the intelligent one who asserts the non-existence of the result.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also the Buddhists.

original: 'di ji ltar mtshungs she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mtshungs she na /
translated: How is this the same?

original: gal te zho sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zho sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If curd, etc. are stated, etc.

original: 'di yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i don du'o//
analyzed: 'di yod pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i don du'o//
translated: This is stated for the purpose of proving that this exists, because it is non-activity.

original: gal te 'o ma la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la ste /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la ste /
translated: If it is in the nature of milk, etc.,

original: 'o ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la /
translated: in the nature of milk, etc.,

original: zho la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams rnam kun te /
analyzed: zho la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams rnam kun te /
translated: the results characterized by curd, etc. are in every way.

original: ro dang / nus pa dang / rnam par smin pa la sogs pa bdag nyid thams cad kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba'i ngo bos zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yod pa de'i tshe de dag yod na gang gis de dag 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyus bskyed par bya bar 'gyur ba
analyzed: ro dang / nus pa dang / rnam par smin pa la sogs pa bdag nyid thams cad kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba'i ngo bos zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yod pa de'i tshe de dag yod na gang gis de dag 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyus bskyed par bya bar 'gyur ba
translated: If they exist in the form of a difference in all aspects, such as taste, potency, and karmic maturation, like the states of yogurt and so on, then what is the nature of that which is to be generated when they exist?

original: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the nature of that which is to be generated?

original: rgyu la sogs dang 'dra bdag nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs dang 'dra bdag nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the cause and so on.

original: rgyu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the cause and so on‚Äù is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúthat which has a nature.‚Äù

original: rgyu ni rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: rgyu ni rang bzhin no ;
translated: The cause is the essence.üîΩThe word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the sentient being.

original: / sogs pa'i sgras ni sems pa can dang / de dag gi sgra ni zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin par grub pa'i ngo bo bzung ngo //
analyzed: / sogs pa'i sgras ni sems pa can dang / de dag gi sgra ni zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin par grub pa'i ngo bo bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äútheir‚Äù refers to the states of yogurt and so on, which are established as not being subject to generation.

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par thal bsgrub pa'i tshad ma gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par thal bsgrub pa'i tshad ma gnyis bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates the two valid forms of cognition that establish the consequence that cause and effect would not exist.

original: da ni tshad ma gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshad ma gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to clearly demonstrate the valid cognitions, he says:

original: 'bras de yod @154b phyir rgyu yi sa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras de yod @154b phyir rgyu yi sa ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because the effect exists, the cause is like the cognizer.

original: 'bras de zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten na grags pa zho la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras de zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten na grags pa zho la sogs pa'o //
translated: The effect is the great one, etc., and curd, etc., which are renowned in the world.

original: yod phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists means because it exists.

original: rgyu rig bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu rig bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause is like the cognizer.

original: rgyu ni gtso bo dang / 'jig rten na grags pa ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni gtso bo dang / 'jig rten na grags pa ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the primal matter and milk, etc., which are renowned in the world.

original: rig pa ni sems pa can no //
analyzed: rig pa ni sems pa can no //
translated: The cognizer is the conscious being.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir rgyu rig bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir rgyu rig bzhin no //
translated: Because it operates in a manner similar to those, the cause is like the cognizer.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rnam pa thams cad kyis yod pa de ni su zhig gis kyang bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rnam pa thams cad kyis yod pa de ni su zhig gis kyang bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The application is as follows: Whatever exists in every way is not produced by anything,

original: dper na rang bzhin nam sems pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin nam sems pa can bzhin no //
translated: like the nature or the conscious being.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pas 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pas 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and that even in the state of milk, the effect, curd, exists in its entirety.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not inconclusive,

original: khyad par bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa yang bskyed par bya ba nyid yin na thams cad bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
analyzed: khyad par bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa yang bskyed par bya ba nyid yin na thams cad bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
translated: because it is invalidated by the consequence that if what is not to be produced were to be produced, then everything would be produced, and the consequence that there would be an infinite regress.

original: bskyed zin pa yang bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed zin pa yang bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it would follow, absurdly, that what has already been produced would be produced again.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur pa bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur pa bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that the consequence of the absurd possibility that what is accepted as an effect is not an effect is entailed.

original: da ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: da ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to prove that those things which are asserted to be causes are in fact not causes, he says:

original: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the desired things are not causes.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe desired things‚Äù is a remainder.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa dang / sa bon dang 'o ma la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams ni brjod par 'dod pa'i chen po la sogs pa dang zho la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa dang / sa bon dang 'o ma la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams ni brjod par 'dod pa'i chen po la sogs pa dang zho la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The root nature, etc., and the desired things such as seeds and milk are not the causes of the desired things such as curd, etc.,

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i tha snyad du rung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i tha snyad du rung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they are not suitable to be called ‚Äúproductive causes.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum does not exist.

original: 'di la bsgrub bya yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bsgrub bya yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya med pa'o //
translated: Here, because the probandum does not exist, it is the absence of the probandum.

original: de'i ngo bo ni bsgrub bya med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni bsgrub bya med pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the absence of the probandum.

original: 'di yang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i 'bras bu nyid bkag pa las grub ste /
analyzed: 'di yang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i 'bras bu nyid bkag pa las grub ste /
translated: This is also established by the refutation of the effect that was just mentioned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù are stated.

original: gzhan bdag bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin bzhin te /üîΩrgyu ma yin par mngon par 'dod @155a * //
analyzed: gzhan bdag bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin bzhin te / rgyu ma yin par mngon par 'dod @155a * //
translated: ‚ÄúLike another‚Äù means like the nature of another.

original: pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means like the nature of a thing that is not asserted to be a cause.

original: rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang sems pa can te /üîΩskyes bu 'gyur min rang bzhin min //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang sems pa can te / skyes bu 'gyur min rang bzhin min //
translated: A thing that is not asserted to be a cause is a sentient being,

original: zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been said, ‚ÄúA person is not a cause and is not a nature.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bsgrub bya med pa de ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bsgrub bya med pa de ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: That which does not have an effect is not a cause,

original: dper na sems pa can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems pa can lta bu'o //
translated: like a sentient being.üîΩThe thing that is asserted is one that does not have an effect.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang bsgrub bya med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang bsgrub bya med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the nonobservation of a more extensive property.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang thal ba sgrub pa yin te des na gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpes ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang thal ba sgrub pa yin te des na gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpes ci zhig bya /
translated: Both of these are proofs by reductio. Therefore, what is the point of an example that is established for both parties?

original: gang yang grangs can rnams skyes bu la yang gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i tshul gyis longs spyod la byed pa po yin no snyam du sems pa de la de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: gang yang grangs can rnams skyes bu la yang gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i tshul gyis longs spyod la byed pa po yin no snyam du sems pa de la de skad du bshad de /
translated: This is said to be the case for that,

original: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la bdag kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la bdag kyang yin te /
translated: and it is also the self,

original: grol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is ‚Äúliberated.‚Äù

original: de ni grol ba yin pa'i phyir longs spyod par byed pa po gnyis ma yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni grol ba yin pa'i phyir longs spyod par byed pa po gnyis ma yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is liberated, it is not the experiencer of the two, and therefore the example is not unestablished.üîΩBut if you think that the reason is not established by the opponent‚Äôs system,

original: 'on te gsal sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'on te gsal sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIf it is clear, etc.,‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa dogs par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa dogs par byed de /
translated: where he suspects that the reason is not established.

original: de la gal te gtan tshigs dang po mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir zhes khyad par dang bcas pa byed pa de'i tshe ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la gal te gtan tshigs dang po mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir zhes khyad par dang bcas pa byed pa de'i tshe ni ma grub ste /
translated: If the first reason is stated with the qualification ‚Äúbecause the nature of all things such as manifestation exist,‚Äù then it is not established.

original: kho bo cag gis mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos kyang 'bras bu yod par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos kyang 'bras bu yod par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not accept that the effect exists by the nature of manifestation, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, do you accept?

original: nus pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: nus pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: We accept that it exists by the nature of potentiality.

original: ci ste spyir khyad par med pa yin pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste spyir khyad par med pa yin pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you say that in general there is no difference, then your reason is inconclusive.

original: 'di ltar mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For, the difference in characteristics, such as manifestation, etc., is not what is to be produced.

original: des thams cad 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des thams cad 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that everything is not an effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the second reason is also unestablished.

original: bsgrub bya yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum is present.

original: gsal sogs mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras shas che ba dang shas chung ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bzung ngo //
analyzed: gsal sogs mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras shas che ba dang shas chung ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúsuch as manifestation‚Äù include the differences in states, such as greater and lesser.

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the difference.

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni glan ka'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni glan ka'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesignation‚Äù is the objection.

original: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te //
analyzed: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te //
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of manifestation, etc.

original: bsgrub bya med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the error of ‚Äúbecause the object of attainment does not exist‚Äù would not occur.

original: gal te de ltar sngar de yod ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sngar de yod ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: If you reply to that as follows: ‚ÄúPreviously, it existed,‚Äù and so on,

original: de la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste /
translated: then that should be analyzed in two parts:

original: khyad @155b par 'di mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs las sngar rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang yod dam /
analyzed: khyad @155b par 'di mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs las sngar rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang yod dam /
translated: Is there a time prior to the occasion when the distinction is clearly manifest, a time when the nature of the thing exists?

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Or is there not?

original: gal te yod pa yin na de'i tshe khyed cag gis gtan tshigs gnyi ga yang ma grub pa la sogs pa la lan btab pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gal te yod pa yin na de'i tshe khyed cag gis gtan tshigs gnyi ga yang ma grub pa la sogs pa la lan btab pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: If it does exist, then at that time, you have no reply at all to the argument that both reasons are not established and so on.

original: 'on te sngar yod pa med pa de lta na yang khyad par de ltar rgyu de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te sngar yod pa med pa de lta na yang khyad par de ltar rgyu de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: But if it does not exist, then even though it is like that, the distinction arises from those causes.

original: khyed kyi med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi med pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is illogical to say, ‚ÄúBecause you do not make that which does not exist.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig med pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig med pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, this reason, ‚Äúbecause that which does not exist is not produced,‚Äù is established.

original: da ni rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bzhi po bsgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩde phyir bsgrub bya med pas na //
analyzed: da ni rgyu len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bzhi po bsgrub pa'i phyir / de phyir bsgrub bya med pas na //
translated: Now, in order to establish the four reasons beginning with ‚Äúbecause of the acceptance of a cause,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, because the object to be established does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir rgyu len par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir rgyu len par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the object to be established does not exist, as explained by the reasoning, the acceptance of a cause will not occur,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu de 'dod pa nyid kyis de dag rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu de 'dod pa nyid kyis de dag rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are imaginative accept a cause only because they desire the effect that is to be established.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa'i nges pa las zho la sogs pa skye'i zhes bya ba 'di yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'i nges pa las zho la sogs pa skye'i zhes bya ba 'di yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: This also will not occur: ‚ÄúCurds and so on are produced from milk and so on,‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the object to be established does not exist.

original: 'dis kyang thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: This also establishes ‚Äúbecause all is unproduced.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar thams cad las skye pa med pa nyid nges pa las skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad las skye pa med pa nyid nges pa las skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called ‚Äúproduction‚Äù from the ascertainment that there is no production from anything.

original: de yang 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs la mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs la mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, that is not tenable in the system of the proponents of existent effects,

original: bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum does not exist.

original: de bzhin du nus pa ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nus pa ni nus pa byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, these two, ‚Äúbecause the potential produces the potential‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause the potential produces the effect,‚Äù are also illogical,

original: bsgrub bya med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum does not exist.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig mngon par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa ni nus par gzhag la /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig mngon par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa ni nus par gzhag la /
translated: If something establishes something else, then the establishment is posited as the potential,

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang byed par grub kyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang byed par grub kyi /
translated: and the probandum is established as the effect,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de ston par byed pa ni //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa ni //
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said:

original: nus pa med cing bya ba'ang med //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa med cing bya ba'ang med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: There is no potential and there is no activity.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that the cause of things exists,

original: bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum does not exist.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said:

original: bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is complete in all aspects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di yang rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: And this is established by the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of a cause.‚Äù

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs thams cad thal ba las bzlog par sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩyang skabs gzhan gyis 'bras bu yod par smra @156a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs thams cad thal ba las bzlog par sbyar bar bya'o // yang skabs gzhan gyis 'bras bu yod par smra @156a * //
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of an effect,‚Äù should be applied to all reductio arguments.

original: ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, in order to refute the assertion of the existence of an effect in another context,

original: sgrub pa zhugs pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhugs pa thams cad ni //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAll proofs . . .

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúProof‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúengagement.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log smos pas the tshom yang bzung ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log smos pas the tshom yang bzung ste /
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúerror,‚Äù he includes doubt as well,

original: 'di ni gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both of these are superimpositions in that they focus on both aspects.

original: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa thams cad rang gi yul la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa thams cad rang gi yul la 'jug pa na /
translated: Because all proofs engage their objects,

original: gnyis byed de /
analyzed: gnyis byed de /
translated: they are twofold:üîΩWhen they engage the object, the object of comprehension,

original: gzhal bar bya ba'i don gyi yul la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba'i don gyi yul la 'jug pa na /
translated: When the mind engages its object, the object to be evaluated,üîΩ

original: phyin ci log dang the tshom zlog par byed pa dang / yul de la nges pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang the tshom zlog par byed pa dang / yul de la nges pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the reversal of error and doubt, and it generates certainty about that object.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba la rigs pas mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba la rigs pas mi 'thad do //
translated: This is not logically tenable for the proponents of existent effects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: the tshom dang ni phyin ci log / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: the tshom dang ni phyin ci log / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúDoubt and error,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gi lugs kyis the tshom dang phyin ci log dag sems pa can gyi bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gi lugs kyis the tshom dang phyin ci log dag sems pa can gyi bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: Thus, according to your system, are doubt and error the nature of the sentient being?

original: blo dang yid kyi rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: blo dang yid kyi rang bzhin yin /
translated: Or are they the nature of the mind and mental factors?

original: phyogs gnyi ga la yang de dag bzlog tu med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga la yang de dag bzlog tu med pa yin te /
translated: In both cases, their reversal is impossible.

original: sems pa can blo dang yid rnams rtag pa nyid kyis de dag kyang rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa can blo dang yid rnams rtag pa nyid kyis de dag kyang rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sentient being, the mind, and the mental factors are permanent, and therefore they are also permanent.

original: sgrub par byed pa las nges pa bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa las nges pa bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does certainty arise from a proof,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because this very cause remains in all circumstances.

original: de'i phyir 'di la khyed cag gis sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa 'di smras pa de kun te thams cad don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la khyed cag gis sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa 'di smras pa de kun te thams cad don med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of these proofs that you have stated are pointless.

original: 'di ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bstan pa yin te /
