analyzed: de ni sems pa can dang bde ba dang rig pa dang / shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag gis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by such synonyms as ‚Äúsentience,‚Äù ‚Äúpleasure,‚Äù ‚Äúawareness,‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams rig pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas myang ba zhes bya bar 'gyur na /üîΩde'i tsha de dag rig pa yin pa sim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams rig pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas myang ba zhes bya bar 'gyur na / de'i tsha de dag rig pa yin pa sim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: If pleasure, etc., are said to be experienced by another awareness,

original: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rnal 'byor pa dang rjes su dpog pa po gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa myong bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rnal 'byor pa dang rjes su dpog pa po gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa myong bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: then that awareness would be of the nature of pleasure, etc., because it is not itself of that nature, just as the pleasure, etc., of another yogi or of another inferor are not experienced.

original: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa de dag kyang /
translated: If that were not so, then those yogis, etc.,

original: nad pa la sogs pa bzhin du dngos su bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad pa la sogs pa bzhin du dngos su bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would directly experience pleasure, etc., just as the sick, etc., do.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, like the yogis, etc., they would not experience benefit or harm.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: rig pa yang sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa na bde ba la sogs rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub po //
analyzed: rig pa yang sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa na bde ba la sogs rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub po //
translated: And if you accept that cognition is the nature of pleasure, etc., then pleasure, etc. are established as being the nature of cognition.

original: sim pa dang sim pa ma yin par myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid kho bo cag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: sim pa dang sim pa ma yin par myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid kho bo cag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: This very experience of pleasure and pain is our pleasure and pain.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba thams cad la sgra la sogs pa rig pa'i ngo bo dang bral bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba thams cad la sgra la sogs pa rig pa'i ngo bo dang bral bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in things that are similar.

original: gzhan du rnam par shes par smra ba'i lugs nyid khas blangs pa byas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par shes par smra ba'i lugs nyid khas blangs pa byas par 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, you would be accepting the system of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins.

original: de yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: And that is precisely what we accept.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in things that are similar.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar rig pa ni sngon po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na yang phyi rol na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa nye ba'i @162a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar rig pa ni sngon po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na yang phyi rol na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa nye ba'i @162a * //
translated: One might think, Even though cognition is not of the nature of blue, etc., because of the proximity of external blue, etc.,

original: phyir ; sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin du sim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rlom mo
analyzed: phyir ; sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin du sim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rlom mo
translated: it appears as the nature of blue, etc. In the same way, even though it is not of the nature of pleasure, etc., by the power of the appropriation of external pleasure, etc., it is imagined to be of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: // des na rig pa ni sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // des na rig pa ni sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though cognition is of the nature of pleasure, etc., pleasure, etc. are not established as the nature of cognition.

original: de'i phyir // rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir // rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa //
translated: Therefore, the fundamental reason is uncertain.

original: yin no snyam du dgos pa la //üîΩsgra sogs gcig bu kho na la //
analyzed: yin no snyam du dgos pa la // sgra sogs gcig bu kho na la //
translated: Thinking this,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says sound, etc. are singular, etc.

original: goms dang rigs kyi bye brag las //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: goms dang rigs kyi bye brag las //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: In due to the difference of habituation and type, etc.

original: goms pa ni mang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa ni mang du byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHabit‚Äù means repeated practice.

original: rigs ni rang gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs ni rang gi rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúType‚Äù means natural disposition.

original: de dag gi bye brag ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDifference‚Äù means distinction.

original: chags pa la sogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment, etc.‚Äù means attachment, aversion, and so on.

original: chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù means strong desire.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dga' ba la sogs pa dang / sdang ba dang skyo ba la sogs pa dang / dman pa dang sgrib pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dga' ba la sogs pa dang / sdang ba dang skyo ba la sogs pa dang / dman pa dang sgrib pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include such things as delight, hatred, and so on, and such things as inferiority, obscuration, and so on.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi rnam pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDetermination‚Äù means a particular kind.

original: 'di ltar goms pa'i khyad par gyis chad dang bud med la sogs pa rnams la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i mtshan mar goms pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams dang rigs kyi khyad par yang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa'i khyad par gyis chad dang bud med la sogs pa rnams la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i mtshan mar goms pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams dang rigs kyi khyad par yang ste /
translated: Thus, through the difference of habit, there is a particular kind of delight, etc., in some people, such as the lustful, the cruel, and so on, in regard to such things as women, etc., which are the signs of the attractive and the unattractive.

original: rta dang glang po'i phru gu la sogs pa so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gi dga' ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rta dang glang po'i phru gu la sogs pa so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gi dga' ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: There is also a particular kind of type, such as the young of horses, elephants, and so on. Delight, etc., arise in some people, but not in all.

original: sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa na 'di yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa na 'di yang mi rigs so //
translated: If sound and so on are the essence of pleasure and so on, this is also illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos gcig rjes su 'brangs nas ni //
analyzed: dngos gcig rjes su 'brangs nas ni //
translated: Because, following the single entity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de dag thams cad ni dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all of them have objects that are not different entities,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rig pa bzhin du rig pa re re yang sna tshogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di snyam du dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang ma mthong ba la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rig pa bzhin du rig pa re re yang sna tshogs par thal bar 'gyur ro // 'di snyam du dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang ma mthong ba la sogs pa la ste /
translated: like the cognition of blue and so on, it follows that each cognition would be diverse.

original: chos thams cad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig skyed pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi ngo bor snang gi /
analyzed: chos thams cad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig skyed pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi ngo bor snang gi /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIndeed, it has the nature of the three entities, but it appears as the essence of some to some due to the power of co-arising characteristics of all phenomena and so on,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: not all to all,‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni goms pa dang rigs kyi bye brag dang len par 'dod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni goms pa dang rigs kyi bye brag dang len par 'dod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the distinctions of practice, type, and desire to accept.

original: gal te @162b de lta bas na /üîΩdngos po'i rjes su 'brang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te @162b de lta bas na / dngos po'i rjes su 'brang mi 'gyur //
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen consciousness does not follow the entity.

original: rig pa de dngos po la dmigs par mi 'gyur te /üîΩde'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa de dngos po la dmigs par mi 'gyur te / de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: That consciousness does not have the entity as its object,üîΩbecause it is empty of the form of that.

original: de'i rnam pas stong pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam pas stong pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is empty of the form of that, he says:

original: dngos po'i ngo bo rnam gsum pa //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo rnam gsum pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The nature of the entity is threefold.üîΩThe nature of the entity is threefold,

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: as sattva, rajas, and tamas.üîΩThe consciousness of that is of one type.

original: de yi rig pa rnam pa gcig / ces bya ba'i skyes bu de dag gi rig pa ni yang dag par rig pa dag ste /
analyzed: de yi rig pa rnam pa gcig / ces bya ba'i skyes bu de dag gi rig pa ni yang dag par rig pa dag ste /
translated: The consciousness of those beings is the correct consciousnesses.

original: re re la yang zhen pa la sogs pa tsam ngo bo gcig nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re re la yang zhen pa la sogs pa tsam ngo bo gcig nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because each of them is definitely of one nature, which is mere attachment and so on,

original: rnam pa gcig rig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig rig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said that the consciousness is of one type.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni rig pa rnams so //
translated: Those means the consciousnesses.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to sound, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúCorrectly‚Äù means ultimately, is the meaning.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: de dang mi mthun zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is not compatible with that.‚Äù

original: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not compatible with the entity that is its objective referent.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pa rig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pa rig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not the cognition of a certain form is not the subject of that,

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, auditory consciousness is not the subject of a visual form.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rig pa yang gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rig pa yang gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition as explained is empty of the form of an entity that is a triad, is the non-apprehension of the pervasive.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The absurd consequence is

original: bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: the valid cognition that contradicts the opposite.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon sum gyis bzung nas goms pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis skad cig ma la sogs pa 'ga' zhig nyid du nges pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon sum gyis bzung nas goms pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis skad cig ma la sogs pa 'ga' zhig nyid du nges pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: One might think as follows: How is it that things such as sound are apprehended by direct perception in all their aspects, and that through the power of habituation, etc., ascertainment of some of their aspects, such as their momentariness, arises?

original: thams cad la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis rig pa rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: thams cad la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis rig pa rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúJust as things such as sound are apprehended by direct perception in all their aspects, but through the power of habituation, etc., ascertainment arises in regard to some things, such as momentariness, but not in regard to all things, in the same way, through the power of not seeing, etc., cognition becomes of a single aspect.‚Äù

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: kho bo cag ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang don dam par dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang don dam par dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that conceptual thoughts such as momentariness are objects of real things.

original: dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because things are beyond all conceptual thought.

original: brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are indirectly related to things,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: they are valid cognitions because they are causes for attaining things of that kind.

original: gzhan dag gis dga' ba la sogs pa ni don dam par dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dga' ba la sogs pa ni don dam par dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: Others believe that joy, etc. are ultimately the subjective aspect of the object,

original: rnam pa gzhan du na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra @163a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra @163a * //
translated: otherwise, if they were devoid of objective support, the experience of the sound, etc. that have the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: la sogs pa rnams nyams su myong bas bde ba la sogs pa myong ba gsal ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa rnams nyams su myong bas bde ba la sogs pa myong ba gsal ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not be clear, i.e. the experience of pleasure, etc. would not be clear.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since these, joy, etc. are associated with conceptualization,

original: ma nges pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas bdag nyid thams cad kyis nyams su myong ba gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas bdag nyid thams cad kyis nyams su myong ba gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are not indeterminate in the slightest, hence, they are clear and experienced in all their aspects.

original: rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi nges pa yin no //
translated: That which is the realization of one‚Äôs own aim is the certainty of those who are certain.

original: ji skad du rab tu dang ba dang gdung ba dang spong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa
analyzed: ji skad du rab tu dang ba dang gdung ba dang spong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa
translated: It is said that sound and so on are established as possessing pleasure and so on because the effects of faith, longing, and rejection and so on are observed.

original: yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is indefinite,

original: skyes bu gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOne person,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar ser skya pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams tha dad par skyes bu la sgom par byed pa na rnal 'byor pa legs par goms pa rnams skyes bu la dmigs nas rab tu dang ba dang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ser skya pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams tha dad par skyes bu la sgom par byed pa na rnal 'byor pa legs par goms pa rnams skyes bu la dmigs nas rab tu dang ba dang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus when the yogis of Kapila meditate on a person as different, those yogis who are well trained, having observed a person, feel faith and joy.

original: rnal 'byor lam goms pa ches myur bar ma mthong bas skyo bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor lam goms pa ches myur bar ma mthong bas skyo bar 'gyur la /
translated: Those who are not well trained on the path of yoga see the person as impermanent and feel sorrow.

original: yang gang dag rang bzhin gyis blo gros blun pa de dag la sgrib pa skye'i /
analyzed: yang gang dag rang bzhin gyis blo gros blun pa de dag la sgrib pa skye'i /
translated: Those who are naturally dull feel obscuration.

original: gzhan dag gis skyes bu de yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de'i ngo bor 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis skyes bu de yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de'i ngo bor 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Others believe that the person is not the nature of these three qualities.

original: de lta bas na rab tu dang pa dang gdung ba dang / spong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu dang pa dang gdung ba dang / spong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the effect of faith, passion, and aversion, etc. is observed, this is indeterminate.

original: gal te dga' ba la sogs pa de dag kun du rtog pa las 'gyur gyi skyes bu las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba la sogs pa de dag kun du rtog pa las 'gyur gyi skyes bu las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If these, faith, etc. arise from imagination and not from the person,

original: 'di ni sgra la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: this is the same for sound, etc.

original: de'i phyir kun du rtog pa tsam las byung ba nyid yod na phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du rtog pa tsam las byung ba nyid yod na phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, if it is the case that they arise from mere imagination, external pleasure, etc. are not established,

original: kun du rtog pa ni rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ni rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because imagination is the nature of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dbang gis rig pa sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'khrul pa can yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dbang gis rig pa sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'khrul pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also erroneous to say that consciousness is the nature of satisfaction, etc. by the power of the cause of external pleasure, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi yul gyi nye bar len pa med na yang skyes bu la dmigs nas dga' ba la sogs pa rnams skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul gyi nye bar len pa med na yang skyes bu la dmigs nas dga' ba la sogs pa rnams skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because we see that joy, etc. arise in relation to a person, even when there is no external object to appropriate.

original: gang yang 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa las phyi rol gyi yul nye ba la mi ltos par bde ba la sogs pa rig pa yin par 'grub pa de ji ltar gzhan gyi nye bar len pa las 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa las phyi rol gyi yul nye ba la mi ltos par bde ba la sogs pa rig pa yin par 'grub pa de ji ltar gzhan gyi nye bar len pa las 'gyur te /
translated: And how could pleasure, etc. be established as awarenesses that do not depend on the proximity of an external object, from the conceptualization of the desirable and the undesirable?

original: gal @163b te yon tan gsum gyi yid kyang de'i nye bar len pa las byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal @163b te yon tan gsum gyi yid kyang de'i nye bar len pa las byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind of the three qualities arises from that appropriation,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de la yang gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been shown that it is the nature of awareness, etc.,

original: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚Äúbecause of concomitance,‚Äù is unestablished.

original: da ni gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas yang ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas yang ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, having accepted the establishment of the reason, in order to demonstrate that it is still uncertain, he says:

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The manifest, etc.

original: gal te gsal ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du grub pa yin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang de'i rgyu gtso bor 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub ste ;
analyzed: gal te gsal ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du grub pa yin mod kyi / 'on kyang de'i rgyu gtso bor 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub ste ;
translated: If the manifest is established as having the nature of the three qualities,üîΩnevertheless, the cause of that, which is asserted to be the primal substance, is not established.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu dang gang du yang gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba ma grub bo snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar de'i rgyu yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid gcig pu rtag pa khyab pa sgrub par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu dang gang du yang gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba ma grub bo snyam du bsams pa yin no // 'di ltar de'i rgyu yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid gcig pu rtag pa khyab pa sgrub par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The idea is that a cause of that sort is not established as being related to any reason.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu dang gang du yang gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu dang gang du yang gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the cause of that, which is asserted to be a permanent, pervasive, single entity having the nature of the three qualities, is not established as being related to any reason.

original: 'bras bu gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dmigs pa rgyu rnams kyang gdon mi za bar de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dmigs pa rgyu rnams kyang gdon mi za bar de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The entities of the effects that are observed do not necessarily have to be the entities of their causes.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cause and effect are different.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / khyab byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / khyab byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, you assert that the effect called ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù possesses a cause, impermanence, and the quality of not being an all-pervading entity, and so on.

original: de'i rgyu ni de'i ngo bor 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni de'i ngo bor 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But you do not assert that its cause is of the same nature as that effect.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, your reason is indefinite.

original: chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is contradictory because it proves a property of the subject that is contrary to the way it actually exists, he says:

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat cause‚Äù and so on.

original: gcig pu dang / rtag pa dang / yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid rgyur gyur pa'i chos can bsgrub par 'dod la /
analyzed: gcig pu dang / rtag pa dang / yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid rgyur gyur pa'i chos can bsgrub par 'dod la /
translated: You assert that the subject is a cause that is singular, permanent, and the nature of the three qualities.

original: de yang de lta bur gyur pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: de yang de lta bur gyur pa ma grub bo //
translated: But that cause does not exist in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: phyin ci log tu'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni rigs gcig ldan ma yin //
analyzed: de ni rigs gcig ldan ma yin //
translated: It is not endowed with a single type.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.üîΩ

original: ni'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù means ‚Äúfor.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu de gcig pu yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i rigs dang ldan par grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu de gcig pu yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i rigs dang ldan par grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the effect called ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù is not established as having a single nature that is the essence of the three qualities.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if it is not so, then what is it?

original: du ma nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du dmigs so //
analyzed: du ma nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du dmigs so //
translated: It is observed to have the qualities of being manifold, impermanent, and so on.

original: gal te gsal ba ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs gcig dang @164a * //üîΩldan pa yin na /üîΩde'i tshe de'i rgyu yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pas grub po //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs gcig dang @164a * // ldan pa yin na / de'i tshe de'i rgyu yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pas grub po //
translated: If the manifest has a single type of quality, as explained,üîΩthen at that time its cause would also be established as having the qualities of the specific properties of the effect, as explained.

original: ji srid du 'bras bu mi rtag pa nyid dang / du ma nyid kyi chos dang ldan par mthong ba'i phyir de'i rgyu yang de lta bu nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid du 'bras bu mi rtag pa nyid dang / du ma nyid kyi chos dang ldan par mthong ba'i phyir de'i rgyu yang de lta bu nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: As long as the effect is seen to have the qualities of impermanence and manifoldness, its cause should be inferred to be just like that.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gi don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ni rgyu tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gi don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ni rgyu tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to function either gradually or non-gradually, and because a variety of effects is produced by a variety of causes.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no cause.

original: de lta bas na gtso bo rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bor ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtso bo rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bor ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the primal substance is not established as permanent and as a single entity.

original: gal te yang rgyu mi rtag pa dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid la gtso bo zhes ming 'dogs na de'i tshe ming la mi rtsod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu mi rtag pa dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid la gtso bo zhes ming 'dogs na de'i tshe ming la mi rtsod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If, however, you think that it is not a contradiction to call an impermanent and multiple entity a cause, then we will not argue about the name.

original: yang ci'i phyir gsal ba rigs gcig dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gsal ba rigs gcig dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why, then, do you not accept that all manifestations have a single type?

original: gsal ba thams cad lcags kyi ni //
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad lcags kyi ni //
translated: All manifestations are of iron,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: ji ltar lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi thur ma phan tshun ma 'byar ba de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'di dag rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid kyis yul dang dus dang nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pas phan
analyzed: ji ltar lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi thur ma phan tshun ma 'byar ba de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'di dag rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid kyis yul dang dus dang nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pas phan
translated: Just as the iron of a pair of tongs does not touch each other, so too, these manifest entities such as sound, etc., are not mixed with each other because of their differences of place, time, potency, appearance, etc.,

original: tshun du ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: tshun du ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: since they abide in their own individual natures.

original: 'dis ni du ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni du ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates their multiplicity.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rim pa dang 'brel pa'i lus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rim pa dang 'brel pa'i lus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To demonstrate their impermanence, he says, ‚Äúthe body that is related to the sequence of arising.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i rim pa dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The body that is related to the sequence of arising,

original: yang dag par sprel ba'i lus gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sprel ba'i lus gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: that is, the body that is connected with the sequence of arising.üîΩHow is it that they exist?

original: 'on ci ltar yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bo dang / de bzhin du de nyid 'di yin no zhes dngos po rnams bstan pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan par nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bo dang / de bzhin du de nyid 'di yin no zhes dngos po rnams bstan pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan par nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are ascertained as having the nature of being indicated by words, such as ‚Äúthis is that very thing‚Äù?

original: rtog dang 'dres pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rtog dang 'dres pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: They have the nature of being mixed with conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the statement:

original: don rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dzin pa 'di ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dzin pa 'di ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The apprehension of objects as unitary is a false imagination.

original: 'di yang skad cig ma 'jig pa la sogs par phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang skad cig ma 'jig pa la sogs par phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown later in the refutation of the momentariness of things.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the reason ‚Äúbecause of the existence of subsequent cognition‚Äù is shown to be unestablished, contradictory, and indeterminate.

original: da ni bum sogs bye brag bzhin //
analyzed: da ni bum sogs bye brag bzhin //
translated: Now, in order to show that the example ‚Äúlike a pot, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe la bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi chos rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe la bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi chos rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: lacks the property of the probandum and the property of the proof, he says:

original: de bzhin 'ji ba'i 'gyur la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin 'ji ba'i 'gyur la sogs // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Likewise, clay, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gser la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gser la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes gold, etc.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyon gzhan sdud pa'am /üîΩ'dre @164b pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyon gzhan sdud pa'am / 'dre @164b pa nyid yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúlikewise‚Äù includes other faults or the very same fault.

original: khyad par rigs gcig ldan ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par rigs gcig ldan ma yin //
translated: The pot is not a member of the class of clay, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the proving property is absent.

original: rgyu mtshan gcig par ma grub ste //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gcig par ma grub ste //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ma grub ces skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma grub ces skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äúnot established‚Äù is supplied from the context.

original: 'dis kyang bsgrub bya'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bsgrub bya'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the property to be proven is not pervaded.

original: 'on te 'ji ba'i gong bu dang gser la sogs pa gcig de dag gi rgyur grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te 'ji ba'i gong bu dang gser la sogs pa gcig de dag gi rgyur grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it established that the lump of clay and gold, etc. are the cause of those?

original: de bzhin du 'ji ba dang gser la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gi rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ji ba dang gser la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gi rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba ma yin nam /

original: de ji ltar gnyis ka med pas yin zhe na /üîΩ'jim gong la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de ji ltar gnyis ka med pas yin zhe na / 'jim gong la sogs tha dad phyir //
