original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the lump of clay, etc. are different.

original: 'jim gong la sogs pa'i yan lag can gcig ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jim gong la sogs pa'i yan lag can gcig ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no single whole such as a lump of clay, etc.

original: phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one part is covered, it follows that all are covered.

original: rigs gcig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs gcig kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a single type.

original: gsal ba so so snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba so so snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the individual appearances of clarity are distinct.üîΩMoreover, this reason ‚Äúbecause of following‚Äù is indeterminate by nature.

original: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: skyes bu sems pa sogs ldan na'ang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu sems pa sogs ldan na'ang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even though a person possesses thought, etc.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu ni sems pa can nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i chos tshad med pa rnams dang ldan par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu ni sems pa can nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i chos tshad med pa rnams dang ldan par 'dod de /
translated: Thus, a person is accepted as possessing immeasurable qualities such as the nature of being a thinker and the nature of being an experiencer.

original: khyed cag gis ni de dag rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu gcig sngon du 'gro ba can du yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed cag gis ni de dag rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu gcig sngon du 'gro ba can du yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But you do not accept that they are preceded by a single cause of that kind.üîΩBut if you do not accept that persons who possess thought, etc.

original: ci ste yang sems pa can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams ni dngos su mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste yang sems pa can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams ni dngos su mi 'dod do //
translated: are real,

original: 'on ci zhen /
analyzed: 'on ci zhen /
translated: then what are they?

original: nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: They are imputed.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu thams cad sems pa can la sogs pa las ldog pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu thams cad sems pa can la sogs pa las ldog pa des na /
translated: Since all persons are the opposite of thought, etc.,

original: don gzhan las ldog pa'i ngo bo sems med pa can gyi rigs de'i rjes su 'gro bar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don gzhan las ldog pa'i ngo bo sems med pa can gyi rigs de'i rjes su 'gro bar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The nature of the other thing is the opposite of that, and it is imputed to be the universal that pervades that.

original: de ni de kho na nyid du gcig tu yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid du gcig tu yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But it is not really existent in that way.

original: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu gcig sngon du song ba nyid med na yang dngos ma yin pa'i skyes bu bzhin du gsal ba 'di la yang ci'i phyir mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu gcig sngon du song ba nyid med na yang dngos ma yin pa'i skyes bu bzhin du gsal ba 'di la yang ci'i phyir mtshungs pa ste /
translated: If that is so, then even if there is no single cause that precedes the existence of pleasure and so on, why is it not the same for this manifestation, like a person who is not real?

original: 'dra bar mi rtag / de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar mi rtag / de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: It is not similar because it is impermanent in the same way. Therefore the reason is indefinite.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúperson‚Äù is used as an illustration.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyid yon tan nyid dang sems pa med pa nyid dang za ba pa la sogs pa @165a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyid yon tan nyid dang sems pa med pa nyid dang za ba pa la sogs pa @165a * //
translated: In the same way, pleasure and so on that exist in the state of the fundamental nature are qualities, they are not conscious, and they are enjoyers.

original: rnams dang ldan pa dang / gtso bo dang skyes bu ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang ldan la /
analyzed: rnams dang ldan pa dang / gtso bo dang skyes bu ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang ldan la /
translated: and the pradhƒÅna and puru·π£a are endowed with permanence and so forth.

original: de dag ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu gcig sngon du 'gro ba can yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu gcig sngon du 'gro ba can yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: And those are not preceded by a single cause that has become such.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bkag go //
translated: Thus, in this way, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being a subsequent state‚Äù is refuted.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gtan tshigs lhag ma sun dbyung ba'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gtan tshigs lhag ma sun dbyung ba'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to refute the remaining reasons by way of a summary method, a mere portion is explained:

original: de bas gtso bo'i rgyu med kyang //
analyzed: de bas gtso bo'i rgyu med kyang //
translated: Therefore, although there is no cause of pradhƒÅna,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de la re zhig tshad yod pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer yod pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yod de zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs 'di gsum char ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig tshad yod pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer yod pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yod de zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs 'di gsum char ma nges pa yin te /
translated: With regard to that, the three reasons that were stated, ‚Äúbecause of having a magnitude,‚Äù ‚Äúbecause of engaging by way of capacity,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of the distinction between cause and effect,‚Äù are all indefinite.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba'i rgyu med na yang tshad la sogs pa 'di dag mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba'i rgyu med na yang tshad la sogs pa 'di dag mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you have not demonstrated a valid cognition that refutes the opposite of what is to be established, and because it is not contradictory that these, such as valid cognitions, exist even without a cause called ‚Äúprimordial nature.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te re zhig rgyu tsam yod pa nyid du sgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te re zhig rgyu tsam yod pa nyid du sgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: In this way, if you are proving that a mere cause exists, then that is an attempt to prove what is already established for us.

original: kho bo cag ni rgyu med par 'bras bu skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgyu med par 'bras bu skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not assert that effects arise without a cause.

original: rgyu tsam la gtso bo zhes ming 'dogs pa ni cung zad kyang gnod pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu tsam la gtso bo zhes ming 'dogs pa ni cung zad kyang gnod pa med do //
translated: There is not the slightest fault in calling a mere cause ‚Äúprimordial nature.‚Äù

original: ci ste gsal ba tshad nges par skyed par byed pa dang / nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yod pa de ltar bsgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gsal ba tshad nges par skyed par byed pa dang / nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yod pa de ltar bsgrub pa yin na /
translated: But if you are proving that a cause exists that has the conception ‚ÄúI will produce a particular effect‚Äù and that engages in the activity of producing a particular effect through having the ability to do so,

original: de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: then that is not established for us.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po med na yang rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las tshad nges pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa skyed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po med na yang rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las tshad nges pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa skyed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if there is no conceiving agent, there is no contradiction in the production of a definite measure, etc., from the power of its own cause.

original: gtso bo ni rtog pa dang ldan par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rtog pa dang ldan par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not logical that the primal substance is conceiving,

original: de ni sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa yang sems pa can gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa yang sems pa can gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a conscious being, and because conceiving is a synonym for a conscious being.

original: gzhan yang nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gal te tha mi dad pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu tsam sgrub pa de'i tshe sgrub pa la sgrub po //
analyzed: gzhan yang nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gal te tha mi dad pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu tsam sgrub pa de'i tshe sgrub pa la sgrub po //
translated: Moreover, this statement ‚Äúbecause it operates by way of power‚Äù means that if you are proving a cause that has the power of non-difference, then the proof is of a similar type.

original: 'on te nus pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyu tha dad pa gcig pu yin na /
analyzed: 'on te nus pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyu tha dad pa gcig pu yin na /
translated: But if you are proving a cause that is a single entity with various powers,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: then the reason is indefinite,

original: de lta bur gyur pa dang gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa dang gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that it is so in any case.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin te /
translated: And the reason is not established.

original: tha dad pa'i nus pa'i dbang gis rgyu 'ga' zhig 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la 'jug @165b pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i nus pa'i dbang gis rgyu 'ga' zhig 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la 'jug @165b pa ma grub ste /
translated: It is not established that some cause engages some effect due to the power of a difference in potential,

original: nus pa rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because potentials are of the nature of themselves.

original: gang yang rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras pa de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras pa de yang ma grub ste /
translated: Also, what was said, ‚Äúbecause the nature is inseparable,‚Äù is not established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of things to disintegrate without a subsequent cause.

original: gang du yang thim pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang du yang thim pa ma grub ste /
translated: Also, it is not established that it dissolves anywhere.

original: 'di ltar thim par 'gyur ba rang gi ngo bo thams cad zhig pa la'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar thim par 'gyur ba rang gi ngo bo thams cad zhig pa la'am /
translated: Thus, it would dissolve in the complete destruction of its own nature,

original: ma zhig pa la yin grang /
analyzed: ma zhig pa la yin grang /
translated: or it would not be destroyed.

original: gal te re zhig zhig pa la yin pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te re zhig zhig pa la yin pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is destroyed, then it follows that it would disintegrate without a subsequent cause.

original: 'on te ma zhig pa la yin na de'i tshe thim pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'on te ma zhig pa la yin na de'i tshe thim pa mi 'thad de /
translated: But if it is not destroyed, then it is not tenable that it dissolves.

original: ma tshang ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba la ni thim pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba la ni thim pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad de /
translated: In the experience of reality that is complete in itself, it is not tenable that it dissolves anywhere.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would arise from everything.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin sna tshogs dbyer med pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because the various natures are not different,

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: this is mutually contradictory.

original: de lta bas na de ltar gtso bo rgyu med na yang rgyu'i nus pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar gtso bo rgyu med na yang rgyu'i nus pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although the primal substance is causeless, the various natures of the effects, such as their size, and the various distinctions between cause and effect are tenable due to the special power of the cause. Therefore your reason is inconclusive.

original: sogs pa'i sgras nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is to be taken as including ‚Äúbecause of engaging through power.‚ÄùüîΩOr,

original: yang na ; de bas gtso bo'i rgyu med kyang //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na ; de bas gtso bo'i rgyu med kyang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: although the primal substance is not a cause,üîΩin the line ‚Äúalthough the primal substance is not a cause,‚Äù

original: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: the word ‚Äúalthough‚Äù means ‚Äúeven though.‚Äù

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu med pa kho nar rgyu'i nus pa'i bye brag gis 'bras bu'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu med pa kho nar rgyu'i nus pa'i bye brag gis 'bras bu'i tshad la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is tenable that the various natures of the effect, such as its size, are due to the specific potency of the cause alone, which is the primary cause, and because it is tenable that the distinctions of cause and effect, etc.,üîΩare established.

original: gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reasons are indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe gsal ba'i rgyu gtso bo yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe gsal ba'i rgyu gtso bo yin na /
translated: In that case, when the cause of manifestation is the primary cause,

original: de'i tshe sna tshogs thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pas de dang 'dra bar rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sna tshogs thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pas de dang 'dra bar rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then since all variety is of its nature, it would be the same as that, a single substance.üîΩIf that were the case, then the distinctions of measure, such as

original: de lta yin dang blo gcig dang // nga rgyal gcig dang de tsam lnga //
analyzed: de lta yin dang blo gcig dang // nga rgyal gcig dang de tsam lnga //
translated: one mind, one pride, and the five subtle elements,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad kyi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad kyi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not occur.

original: de lta yin dang 'gro ba tshad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'gro ba tshad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then there would be only an immeasurable world.

original: de bzhin du rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa byed pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa byed pa na /
translated: In that case, when potters, etc., make pots, etc.,

original: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni gtso bo'i rgyu med pa kho nar 'thad kyi /
analyzed: nus pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni gtso bo'i rgyu med pa kho nar 'thad kyi /
translated: The operation by way of potency is tenable only if there is no primary cause.

original: de yod na ni ma yin te /üîΩnus pa med cing bya ba'ang med //
analyzed: de yod na ni ma yin te / nus pa med cing bya ba'ang med //
translated: If there is a primary cause, it is not tenable.

original: ces sngar ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces sngar ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
translated: As was previously explained, ‚ÄúThere is no potency and no operation.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par dbye ba yang gtso bo rgyu med pa kho na yin @166a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par dbye ba yang gtso bo rgyu med pa kho na yin @166a * //
translated: The distinction of cause and effect is also tenable only if there is no primary cause.

original: na rigs so zhes sngar nyid du shes par byas so //
analyzed: na rigs so zhes sngar nyid du shes par byas so //
translated: This was already understood earlier.

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa yang gtso bo yod na mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa yang gtso bo yod na mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: Also, if there is a primary cause, it is not tenable that there is a diversity of natures.

original: 'gro ba thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Since all of the world has that as its nature, it follows that it is just one, like its own nature.

original: de lta yin dang gang las 'di rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ba rang bzhin sna tshogs pa dang po nyid nas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang las 'di rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ba rang bzhin sna tshogs pa dang po nyid nas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then a diversity of natures would not exist from the beginning, from which this would be undifferentiated.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rang bzhin brtag pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rang bzhin brtag pa ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, the chapter on the examination of nature, from the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: // / da ni dbang phyug gi bya ba dang bral ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni dbang phyug gi bya ba dang bral ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the absence of the activity of the Almighty, he says:üîΩOthers say that the Almighty,üîΩwho is endowed with special qualities,

original: gzhan dag skye ldan thams cad kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag skye ldan thams cad kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is the creator of all beings.

original: skye ba dang mi ldan pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni rtag pa'i phyir rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba dang mi ldan pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni rtag pa'i phyir rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since space, etc., which are not endowed with origination, are permanent, they do not have any cause whatsoever.

original: de'i phyir skye ldan zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ldan zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúendowed with origination.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to the NaiyƒÅyikas, etc.

original: dbang ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: dbang ni dbang phyug go //
translated: ‚ÄúAlmighty‚Äù means ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara.‚Äù

original: de la kha cig ni dbang phyug yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa dag las /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni dbang phyug yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa dag las /
translated: Some say that ƒ™≈õvara, who is endowed with special qualities,

original: gzhan 'gro ba thams cad kyi byed pa po thams cad shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'gro ba thams cad kyi byed pa po thams cad shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: is the creator of all beings, and that he is omniscient.

original: gzhan dag ni bdag las tha dad pa rtag pa gcig pu don thams cad kyi yul can gyi blo dang ldan pa nyid kyis yon tan tha dad pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan nyid yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bdag las tha dad pa rtag pa gcig pu don thams cad kyi yul can gyi blo dang ldan pa nyid kyis yon tan tha dad pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan nyid yin no zhe'o //
translated: Others say that he is a different substance because of the difference in his qualities, since he is the object of all meanings, is permanent, and is one, and is endowed with the cognition that is different from the self.

original: 'on te chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'gro ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'gro ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there causes of the world, such as dharma, nƒÅdharma, and subtle atoms?

original: de ci'i phyir gzhan dbang phyug rgyu nyid du rtog par byed ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gzhan dbang phyug rgyu nyid du rtog par byed ce na de'i phyir /
translated: Why do you imagine that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause?üîΩBecause he is not a conscious being,

original: sems pa med pa rang nyid kyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa rang nyid kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he cannot create his own effects by himself.

original: chos la sogs pa rgyu yin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa rgyu yin mod kyi /
translated: Dharma and so on are causes, but

original: 'on kyang de ni sems pa med pa yin pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang nyid kyis rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni sems pa med pa yin pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang nyid kyis rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are not conscious beings, they cannot create their own effects by themselves without a conscious being to control them.

original: des na de byin gyis rlob pa po 'ga' zhig byed pa por 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: des na de byin gyis rlob pa po 'ga' zhig byed pa por 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that some conscious being is the creator.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa med pa 'ga' zhig rang dbang can dang byin gyis rlob pa por ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa med pa 'ga' zhig rang dbang can dang byin gyis rlob pa por ma mthong ngo //
translated: Because we do not see any nonconscious being as an independent, controlling agent.

original: sbyor ba ni gang sems pa med pa de ni byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang gi 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang sems pa med pa de ni byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang gi 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: That which is not a conscious being cannot create its own effects without a conscious being to control them.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyi gu dang / chu dang / skud pa la sogs pa rdza mkhan dang bral ba'i bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyi gu dang / chu dang / skud pa la sogs pa rdza mkhan dang bral ba'i bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a pot that is separate from the potter, such as a lump of clay, a stick, water, string, and so on.üîΩAnd also, such things as Dharma are devoid of thought.

original: chos la sogs pa yang @166b sems pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa yang @166b sems pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de lta bas na byin gyis rlob pa po gang yin pa 'di nyid dbang phyug yin par grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na byin gyis rlob pa po gang yin pa 'di nyid dbang phyug yin par grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the one who is the consecrator is the Lord.

original: de ltar na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In that case, Dharma, non-Dharma, and so on are not meaningless,

original: dbang phyug ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the Lord is the causal condition.

original: /'di snyam du chos dang chos ma yin pa dang 'du ba'i bdag gang yin pa de nyid byin gyis rlob pa po yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: /'di snyam du chos dang chos ma yin pa dang 'du ba'i bdag gang yin pa de nyid byin gyis rlob pa po yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If you think that the one who is the self that is the basis of Dharma, non-Dharma, and their combination is the consecrator,

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems na /
translated: then what is the point of postulating a Lord?

original: de nyi yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyi yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: bdag de'i tshe shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de'i tshe shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that self would be devoid of consciousness.

original: de ji srid du lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu tshogs pa ma skyes pa de srid du 'di shes pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de ji srid du lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu tshogs pa ma skyes pa de srid du 'di shes pa med pa yin la /
translated: As long as the collection of causes and effects of the body, sense faculties, and so on has not arisen, the self is devoid of consciousness.

original: dmigs su rung ba yin na yang de srid du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba yin na yang de srid du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul mi dmigs na /
translated: If it were suitable to be observed, then it would be observed as long as objects such as form are not observed.

original: dmigs su mi rung ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa gang las dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs su mi rung ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa gang las dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: But how could it be observed as a phenomenon that is not suitable to be observed?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
analyzed: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
translated: This being is not conscious.

original: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //üîΩdbang phyug gis btang yang na mtho ris sam //
analyzed: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med // dbang phyug gis btang yang na mtho ris sam //
translated: I have no control over my own happiness and suffering.

original: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //üîΩzhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur // zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: Whether I go to the higher realms or fall into an abyss is determined by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'di la rnam phug pas dbang phyug sgrub pa las tshad ma gnyis bkod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la rnam phug pas dbang phyug sgrub pa las tshad ma gnyis bkod pa ni /
translated: Here, the proof of ƒ™≈õvara by means of the two valid means of knowledge is set forth by the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka.

original: rang rtsom byed pa'i cha shas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang rtsom byed pa'i cha shas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe parts that are the creator of itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated as follows.

original: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i blo mi mthun pa'i gzhi nyid du gyur pa ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i blo mi mthun pa'i gzhi nyid du gyur pa ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The basis of the disagreement that the two organs apprehend and do not apprehend is preceded by the cause of the intelligent one,

original: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it possesses the special shape of the parts that compose it, like a pot, etc.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni rdul phra rab lta bu'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni rdul phra rab lta bu'o zhes smras te /
translated: The dissimilar instance is like a subtle particle.

original: de la mthong ba dang reg pa'i don dbang po gnyis po de dag gis gzung ba chen po dang / rdzas du ma dang ldan pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas sa dang / chu dang / me'i ming can rdzas rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba dang reg pa'i dbang po dag gis gzung bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mthong ba dang reg pa'i don dbang po gnyis po de dag gis gzung ba chen po dang / rdzas du ma dang ldan pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas sa dang / chu dang / me'i ming can rdzas rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba dang reg pa'i dbang po dag gis gzung bar bya ba ni /
translated: In that regard, the great object that is apprehended by the two organs, seeing and touching, which possesses many substances, and which possesses the cause of the observation of form, etc., the three types of substances named earth, water, and fire, are apprehended by the organs of seeing and touching.

original: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: They are apprehended by the two organs.

original: rlung la sogs pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //üîΩgang gi phyir chen po nyid dang / rdzas du ma dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzugs dang / 'du ba la @167a * //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o // gang gi phyir chen po nyid dang / rdzas du ma dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzugs dang / 'du ba la @167a * //
translated: Wind, etc. are not apprehended.

original: sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyur 'dod la /
analyzed: sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyur 'dod la /
translated: Because bigness, the quality of being composed of many substances, form, aggregation, etc. are held to be the causes of apprehension.

original: de yang rlung la sogs pa la med do //
analyzed: de yang rlung la sogs pa la med do //
translated: And that does not exist for wind, etc.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chen po dang rdzas du ma ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: chen po dang rdzas du ma ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Bigness and being composed of many substances are the causes of apprehension because they are endowed with form and because they are form.

original: rlung ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rlung ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: Wind is not apprehended because it is not endowed with form.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa ni gzugs dang 'du ba'o //üîΩrdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa ni gzugs dang 'du ba'o // rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is endowed with form is aggregated with form.

original: chen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: A dyad, etc. of atoms is not apprehended because it is not big.

original: de la spyir dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub par byed na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: de la spyir dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub par byed na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod de /
translated: In general, if one proves that the cause of that which is and is not apprehended by the two sense organs is prior, there is the fault of proving what is already established.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni gnyi ga la grub pas rtsod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khas blangs pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams ni de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni gnyi ga la grub pas rtsod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khas blangs pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams ni de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a pot, etc. is established for both, there is no dispute, and because it is contradicted by what is accepted, and because atoms, space, etc. are not accepted in that way.

original: de dag kyang rtag pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pas gnod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pas gnod do //
translated: And because they are permanent, they are contradicted by perception, etc.

original: de lta bas na de'i don du blo mi mthun pa'i rten du gyur pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i don du blo mi mthun pa'i rten du gyur pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the basis of the disagreement is mentioned for that purpose.

original: blo sna tshogs pa ni mi mthun pa ste log par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa ni mi mthun pa ste log par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The various cognitions are the disagreement, which is to say, the misconception.

original: 'di'i gzhir gyur pa ni rtsod pa'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhir gyur pa ni rtsod pa'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis of this is the basis of the dispute.

original: de ltar yin na lus dang / dbang po dang / gnas la sogs pa nyid phyogs su byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yin na lus dang / dbang po dang / gnas la sogs pa nyid phyogs su byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the body, sense faculty, and place, etc. are taken as the side,

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: it is not the case that the consequence applies to the atom, etc.

original: rgyu tsam sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub na grub pa las sgrub par 'gyur du 'ongs pas blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: rgyu tsam sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub na grub pa las sgrub par 'gyur du 'ongs pas blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i zhes smos so //
translated: If it is established that the mere cause precedes, it would follow that what is established is being established. Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe cause of the intelligent one,‚Äù

original: grangs can la ldan pa'i don mi 'thad pas grub pa na grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs can la ldan pa'i don mi 'thad pas grub pa na grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the meaning of possession is not tenable for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, it is not established.

original: grangs can gyi blo gtso bo las tha mi dad par 'dod pa la de de nyid kyis de dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi blo gtso bo las tha mi dad par 'dod pa la de de nyid kyis de dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, who asserts that the intellect is not different from the primary nature, it is not that it possesses that by way of being that.

original: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs na bsags pa'i bdag nyid du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs na bsags pa'i bdag nyid du sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is applied to the nature of the collection of the shape of the parts that make up itself.

original: de khyad par dang ldan pa ni rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de khyad par dang ldan pa ni rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: Possessing that distinction is exclusion.

original: de yin pas na ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yin pas na ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, therefore,

original: cha shas bkod pa'i khyad par nyid ni ba lang nyid la sogs pas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: cha shas bkod pa'i khyad par nyid ni ba lang nyid la sogs pas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The difference in the arrangement of the parts is the cause of the error in the case of the cow, etc.

original: de'i phyir rang rtsom byed pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rtsom byed pa zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe difference in the arrangement of its own parts.‚Äù

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa nyid ni rdzas rtsom pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs khyad par du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa nyid ni rdzas rtsom pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs khyad par du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The difference in the arrangement of the parts of a substance is the cause of the error in the case of the cow, etc.

original: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: But the difference in the arrangement of the parts of its own self is not the cause of the error in the case of God.

original: des na blo dang @167b ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid dbang phyug yin no //
analyzed: des na blo dang @167b ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid dbang phyug yin no //
translated: Therefore, he who is intelligent is God.

original: tshad ma 'di ni rang rtsom byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshad ma 'di ni rang rtsom byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: This proof is stated in two verses, beginning with ‚Äúthe difference in the arrangement of its own parts.‚Äù

original: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa de 'di la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa de 'di la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The difference in the arrangement of the parts of its own self is the cause of the error in the case of God.

original: des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is distinguished by that.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs kyi khyad par bstan nas phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs kyi khyad par bstan nas phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the difference in the reason, in order to teach the property of the position, etc.,

original: dbang po gnyis gzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis gzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe two organs are grasped,‚Äù etc.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis of the dispute is the object of the dispute.

original: des smras pa'i tshad ma gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des smras pa'i tshad ma gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the second valid cognition of the opponent,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúLikewise, the cause of the body, etc.,

original: de bzhin lus la sogs pa'i rgyu //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin lus la sogs pa'i rgyu // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is the cause of the body, etc.,

original: lus la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ste /
translated: the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,üîΩif the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,üîΩif the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,üîΩif the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,üîΩif the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,

original: lus la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur rdul phra rab la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa yod na rang gi 'bras bu byed ces 'brel to //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur rdul phra rab la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa yod na rang gi 'bras bu byed ces 'brel to //
translated: if the cause of the body, etc., is the cause of the body, etc.,

original: ji skad du lus dang / gnas dang / dbang po nye bar len pa sems pa cang yi byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni rnag gi 'bras bu rtsom par byed do zhes kho bo cag gis shes te /
analyzed: ji skad du lus dang / gnas dang / dbang po nye bar len pa sems pa cang yi byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni rnag gi 'bras bu rtsom par byed do zhes kho bo cag gis shes te /
translated: We know that the mind that is empowered by the self-empowerment of the body, the place, and the sense faculties initiates the result of the body.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir snal ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir snal ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //

original: gsal byed pa ni gnas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gtso bo rdul phra rab dang ma mthong ba rnams ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i byin gyis rlob pa po la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal byed pa ni gnas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gtso bo rdul phra rab dang ma mthong ba rnams ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i byin gyis rlob pa po la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The proponents of manifestation say that the primary cause of endurance and so on, the subtle particle, is not seen, but it depends on the one who empowers it, the mind that is superior in generating its own result.

analyzed: bsdad nas 'jug pa'i phyir snal ma la sogs pa dang thag bzangs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes tshad ma ston par byed do //
translated: Because it engages after abiding, it is like thread and so on and the weaver and so on.üîΩThis is how they teach their valid cognition.

original: de 'dir ston pa ni /
analyzed: de 'dir ston pa ni /
translated: Here, the master presents his own position:

original: chos dang chos min rdul phran kun //
analyzed: chos dang chos min rdul phran kun //
translated: All particles of virtue and nonvirtue

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: are the cause of the world.

original: go sla'o // blo gros bzang pos kyang 'byin pa'i thog mar skyes bu rnams kyi tha snyad ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: go sla'o // blo gros bzang pos kyang 'byin pa'i thog mar skyes bu rnams kyi tha snyad ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Bhadantƒ´putra says: The first convention of beings is preceded by the teaching of others.

original: dus phyis rab tu byang ba dag don so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na tshig gi tha snyad ma grub pa'i byis pa rnams la ba lang la sogs pa la tshig gi tha snyad don so sor nges pa ni ma la sogs pa'i nye ba @168a * //
analyzed: dus phyis rab tu byang ba dag don so sor nges pa'i phyir ro // dper na tshig gi tha snyad ma grub pa'i byis pa rnams la ba lang la sogs pa la tshig gi tha snyad don so sor nges pa ni ma la sogs pa'i nye ba @168a * //
translated: Later, when they are purified, they ascertain the meaning.

original: bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, children who have not learned the conventions of words ascertain the meaning of the conventions of words for cow and so on through the teaching of their mother and so on.

original: shes ldan dag la don nges phyir //
analyzed: shes ldan dag la don nges phyir //

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byang ba yod pa dag la don nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byang ba yod pa dag la don nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
