original: tha snyad 'di de 'byin pa'i dang por gang zhig sngon du 'gro ba des ston par byed pa de ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: tha snyad 'di de 'byin pa'i dang por gang zhig sngon du 'gro ba des ston par byed pa de ni dbang phyug go //
translated: The first creator of this convention is the one who teaches through being preceded by that. He is ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'jig pa'i dus na yang shes pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa mi 'jig go zhes bya bar grub po /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na yang shes pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa mi 'jig go zhes bya bar grub po /
translated: And when the world is destroyed, the special knowledge of the sentient beings is not destroyed.üîΩThis is established.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of this is:

original: 'byin pa'i dang po skyes bu yi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩ'byin pa ni 'byung ba dang skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde'i dang po ni thog ma'i dus so //
analyzed: 'byin pa'i dang po skyes bu yi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'byin pa ni 'byung ba dang skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i dang po ni thog ma'i dus so //
translated: The first of the elements is the person.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma gzhan 'od byed pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma gzhan 'od byed pas bstan pa ni /
translated: The other valid cognition is taught by Candrakƒ´rti:

original: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The manifestation of the great elements and so on is blessed by the cause of the intelligent being and becomes the cause of pleasure and pain.

original: sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not sentient beings, because they are effects, because they are subject to destruction, and because they possess form and so on,

original: ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: like a pestle and so on.

original: 'di dag ston pa ni 'byung ba che la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ston pa ni 'byung ba che la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teacher demonstrates these with ‚Äúthe great elements, etc.‚Äù

original: blo dang ldan pas byin brlabs zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas byin brlabs zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise one‚Äôs consecration‚Äù means the consecration of the wise one.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs las so //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs las so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the collection of reasons as explained.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the cause of the world, ƒ™≈õvara.

original: ci ste gang gis mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis gus pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de thams cad shes pa nyid du ji ltar 'grub ce na /üîΩkun gyi byed po nyid grub na //
analyzed: ci ste gang gis mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis gus pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de thams cad shes pa nyid du ji ltar 'grub ce na / kun gyi byed po nyid grub na //
translated: But if one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it established that all of that, which is the object of respect for those who desire high status and definite goodness, is omniscience?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the creator of all is established,‚Äù etc.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: yang blo gros bzang po la sogs pas /
analyzed: yang blo gros bzang po la sogs pas /
translated: Also, BhadrapƒÅla, etc.

original: 'di gnas pa mtha' dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: 'di gnas pa mtha' dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid du grub ste /
translated: say, ‚ÄúIt is established as omniscience because it is the cause of the entire world.‚Äù

original: byed pa pos ni 'bras bu dang / nye bar len pa dang / lhan cig byed pa dang / dgos pa dang / yang dag par spyin pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa pos ni 'bras bu dang / nye bar len pa dang / lhan cig byed pa dang / dgos pa dang / yang dag par spyin pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent is known through the effect, the object appropriated, the co-factors, the purpose, and the proper application.

original: 'di la gang zhig gang gi byed pa po yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig gang gi byed pa po yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa shes pa yin te /
translated: Here, whatever is the agent of something is known through the object appropriated of that.

original: dper na kham gzhong la sogs pa'i byed pa po rdza mkhan gyis de'i nye bar len pa ni 'jim gong ngo //
analyzed: dper na kham gzhong la sogs pa'i byed pa po rdza mkhan gyis de'i nye bar len pa ni 'jim gong ngo //
translated: For example, the potter, who is the agent of the pot, etc., has as its object appropriated the lump of clay.

original: lhan cig byed pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The co-factors are the wheel, etc.

original: dgos pa ni chu la @168b sogs pa len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni chu la @168b sogs pa len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to take up water, etc.

original: yang dag par spyin pa ni gnyen yin par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di rab tu grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag par spyin pa ni gnyen yin par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di rab tu grub pa bzhin no //
translated: The proper application is the knowledge that the potter is a friend.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug gis de'i nye bar len pa rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug gis de'i nye bar len pa rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the agent of all the states is God, and the object appropriated of that is the atoms, etc.

original: de'i lhan cig byed pa ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / phyogs dang dus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lhan cig byed pa ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / phyogs dang dus la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its cooperating causes are dharma, adharma, space, time, etc.

original: tha snyad kyi lhan cig byed pa ni spyi dang khyad par dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi lhan cig byed pa ni spyi dang khyad par dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cooperating causes of conventional are the characteristics of universals, particulars, and inherence.

original: dgos pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The purpose is enjoyment.

original: yang dag par spyin pa'i ming can ni skyes bu rnams shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spyin pa'i ming can ni skyes bu rnams shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The person who is the knower of these is called the knower of all.

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad shes pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad shes pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, all this is established as the knowledge of all.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo la sogs shes //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo la sogs shes //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of the effect, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang 'bras bu'i ngo bo la sogs pa ni rang bzhin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang 'bras bu'i ngo bo la sogs pa ni rang bzhin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the effect, etc. are the nature, etc. of the cause.

original: sogs pa'i sgras nye bar len pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras nye bar len pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the appropriation, etc.

original: de dag gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of these is the collection.

original: ya dza ka la sogs pa'i tshogs ma rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: ya dza ka la sogs pa'i tshogs ma rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Because the collection of the yajaka, etc. is incomplete,

original: las la aan gyi sgra'i rkyen bsgrubs nas rang gi don ka'i sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: las la aan gyi sgra'i rkyen bsgrubs nas rang gi don ka'i sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The suffix -ana is added to the root k·πõ, and the suffix -a is added to the root k·πõ.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du de dag gis smras pa'i tshad ma'i tshogs gzhan sna tshogs par 'byung ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba dang / gzhi dang gzhi ma yin pa blo mi mthun pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis gcad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag gis smras pa'i tshad ma'i tshogs gzhan sna tshogs par 'byung ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba dang / gzhi dang gzhi ma yin pa blo mi mthun pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis gcad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, the various collections of valid cognition that they propound, such as the two types of valid cognition, are to be eliminated by another valid cognition that is different from the five valid cognitions, because they are the basis of disagreement about what is a basis and what is not a basis, such as the arising of various things, movement, and so on.

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are entities and so on, they are like form and so on.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is like the hair of a tortoise and so on.

original: de la sna tshogs par 'byung ba ni yon tan gyi tshig gi don la brjod de /
analyzed: de la sna tshogs par 'byung ba ni yon tan gyi tshig gi don la brjod de /
translated: Among those, the arising of various things is expressed as the meaning of the word quality.

original: 'di sna tshogs par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di sna tshogs par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the arising of various things.

original: rab tu g-yo ba ni las kyi tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rab tu g-yo ba ni las kyi tshig gi don to //
translated: Movement is the meaning of the word action.

original: de dag gi gzhi ni 'du ba'i rgyu ste rdzas so //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi ni 'du ba'i rgyu ste rdzas so //
translated: Their basis is the cause of aggregation, i.e., substance.

original: gzhi ma yin pa ni yon tan la sogs pa nas 'du ba'i bar lnga po rnams so//
analyzed: gzhi ma yin pa ni yon tan la sogs pa nas 'du ba'i bar lnga po rnams so//
translated: The non-basis is the five, beginning with quality and ending with aggregation.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga ni rjes su dpag pa nas bzung nas dngos po med pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga ni rjes su dpag pa nas bzung nas dngos po med pa'i bar ro //
translated: The five, beginning with inference and ending with non-existence, are the second and subsequent valid cognitions.

original: de las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The valid cognition different from those is direct perception.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'di yang yin te /üîΩyod pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa non @169a * //
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'di yang yin te / yod pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa non @169a * //
translated: The other reason they state is this:

original: pa dang ma non pa blo mi mthun pa gzhi'i ngo bor gyur pa 'ga' zhig ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: pa dang ma non pa blo mi mthun pa gzhi'i ngo bor gyur pa 'ga' zhig ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: The non-differentiated, such as existence, is direct perception, because it is a basis that is a different mental state with regard to the non-perceived and the perceived.

original: yod pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Because it exists, like form, etc.

original: de la yod pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa rnams drug pa ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa rnams drug pa ste /
translated: Therein, the non-differentiated, such as existence, are the sixth.

original: yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rdzas dang ldan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / spyi'i khyad par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi khyad par med pa ni de dag gis non pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rdzas dang ldan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / spyi'i khyad par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi khyad par med pa ni de dag gis non pa ste /
translated: Existence, impermanence, substance, quality, action, cause, effect, and generality, particularity, and inherence are the particularities of substance, quality, and action.üîΩThe absence of particularity is their inherence.

original: mnan pa ni ji ltar srid par rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las kyi bdag nyid kyi tshig gi don gsum mo //
analyzed: mnan pa ni ji ltar srid par rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las kyi bdag nyid kyi tshig gi don gsum mo //
translated: The three meanings of substance, quality, and action are as many as possible.

original: ma non pa ni spyi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma non pa ni spyi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of inherence is generality and so on.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: tshad ma'i tshogs de dag nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma'i tshogs de dag nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The collection of valid cognitions is taught:

original: mi mthun blo bzhi'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: mi mthun blo bzhi'i dngos po ni //
translated: The four mental incompatibilities are

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di la sgrub byed dang po yi //
analyzed: 'di la sgrub byed dang po yi //
translated: Here, the first proof

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs phyi ma rtsom ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs phyi ma rtsom ste /
translated: and so on, begins the latter position.

original: de la gang sems pa can ma yin pa de ni byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang gi 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de la gang sems pa can ma yin pa de ni byin gyis rlob pa po med par rang gi 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: There, that which is not sentient does not commence its own effect without an enlivener. And so on, in the syllogism,

original: bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because there is no valid cognition to contradict the reversal of the probandum, the reason is indeterminate due to doubt about the reversal in the dissimilar class.

original: gang yang rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dang po ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: gang yang rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dang po ni ma grub bo //
translated: Also, the first application of the reason ‚Äúbecause it possesses the particular parts that compose itself‚Äù is unestablished.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúbecause . . . .‚Äù

original: cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi sgras ni ldan pa'i khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi sgras ni ldan pa'i khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: By the term ‚Äúshape of the parts,‚Äù the particular possessor of the parts is intended.

original: de'i khyad par du byas pa yang yan lag can zhes bya ba'i rdzas so //
analyzed: de'i khyad par du byas pa yang yan lag can zhes bya ba'i rdzas so //
translated: That which is qualified by it is the substance called the whole.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gnyi ga yang ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gnyi ga yang ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Since neither the qualifier nor the qualified is established, the reason is unestablished in two ways.

original: yang ji ltar gnyi ga ma grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gnyi ga ma grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is it that neither is established?

original: bltar rung nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bltar rung nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the possibility of seeing, etc.‚Äù

original: de la mdor bsdus nas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes pa nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar bshad do //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdus nas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes pa nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar bshad do //
translated: In brief, the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is explained as the invalidating means of valid knowledge.

original: rgyas par ni 'di dag gi skyon tshig gi don drug brtag par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas par ni 'di dag gi skyon tshig gi don drug brtag par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: In detail, the faults of these are to be taught in the examination of the six categories of word-meaning.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang cha shas can du yang dag par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang cha shas can du yang dag par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the one who is rightly believed to be the shape and the one who is rightly believed to be the possessor of parts.

original: 'di ltar dbyibs ltar rung ba nyid du khas blangs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyibs ltar rung ba nyid du khas blangs te /
translated: Thus, the possibility of seeing the shape is accepted.

original: grangs dang / tshad dang / tha dad pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa @169b dag dang / las ni gzugs can dang 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs dang / tshad dang / tha dad pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa @169b dag dang / las ni gzugs can dang 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the number, size, difference, possession, division, and identity and difference of the shape are apprehended by the eye because of the connection with the visible.

original: cha shas can yang bltar rung ba nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: cha shas can yang bltar rung ba nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The possessor of parts is also accepted as the possibility of seeing.

original: chen po ni du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: chen po ni du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro // gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par ldan pa'am /
translated: because the great elements are many, and because they are form, they are objects.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the elements are not objects because they are not different from form, etc.,

original: cha shas can snang du rung ba nyid du 'dod pa ni blo la snang ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: cha shas can snang du rung ba nyid du 'dod pa ni blo la snang ba ma yin pas /
translated: or because they are not the appearance of a part of the possessor of parts.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since they are not objects in the sense of being objects of observation,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //üîΩrdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no // rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: they are the objects of the convention of nonexistence, like the horn of a donkey.üîΩIt is not the case that form, etc., are not objects of observation because the atoms are beyond the senses,

original: khyad par can rnams dbang po'i yul du khas blangs pas dbang po las 'das pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can rnams dbang po'i yul du khas blangs pas dbang po las 'das pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas accept that the special qualities are objects of the senses, and therefore it is not established that they are beyond the senses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ldan pa dang cha shas can dag med pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i dpe bum pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ldan pa dang cha shas can dag med pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i dpe bum pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since there is no possessor of attributes or a whole, the example, a pot, is devoid of the attribute to be established.

original: de lta bas na dpe 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dpe 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, this example is also not established.

original: de ltar re zhig khyad par dang khyad par can ma grub pas gtan tshigs rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig khyad par dang khyad par can ma grub pas gtan tshigs rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, since the qualifier and the qualified are not established, the reason is shown to be non-established due to the non-establishment of its own nature.

original: da ni gzhi'i phyogs gcig ma grub pas kyang ma grub pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gzhi'i phyogs gcig ma grub pas kyang ma grub pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show that it is also non-established due to the non-establishment of one part of the basis,

original: mig dang reg pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang reg pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe eye and the tactile,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di la chos can rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di la chos can rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: Here, two types of subjects are taught:

original: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: those apprehended by two sense faculties and those not apprehended.

original: de la dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ni cung zad kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ni cung zad kyang ma grub ste /
translated: Among them, the subject that is apprehended by two sense faculties is not established in the least.

original: 'di ltar mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis ka go rims bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg bya'i khyad par tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa snang ba can du nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis ka go rims bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg bya'i khyad par tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa snang ba can du nye bar skye'o //
translated: Thus, the two, the visual consciousness and the tactile consciousness, arise as having different appearances, because the former has the mere form of blue, etc., as its object, and the latter has the mere particular of roughness, etc., as its object.

original: de lta yin dang mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag yul gcig pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag yul gcig pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, those two, the visual consciousness and the tactile consciousness, would not have the same object,

original: tha dad du snang ba'i phyir dri dang ro la sogs pa'i rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad du snang ba'i phyir dri dang ro la sogs pa'i rig pa bzhin no //
translated: because they have different appearances, like the consciousnesses of smell and taste, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag tha dad du snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa de dag ni yul gcig pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag tha dad du snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa de dag ni yul gcig pa can ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Those consciousnesses that have different appearances do not have the same object,

original: dper na dri dang ro'i rnam par shes pa gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dri dang ro'i rnam par shes pa gnyis bzhin no //
translated: like the two, the consciousness of smell and the consciousness of taste.

original: mig dang @170a * //
analyzed: mig dang @170a * //
translated: The visual consciousness and the tactile consciousness are consciousnesses that have different appearances.

original: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang tha dad par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang tha dad par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervader.

original: snang ba tha dad pa can yang yul gcig pa nyid yin na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i sems kyang yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa can yang yul gcig pa nyid yin na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i sems kyang yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If the different appearances have the same object, then the mind of form, sound, and so on would also have the same object. This is the valid cognition that contradicts the opponent's position.

original: 'o na gal te de dag yul gcig pa ma yin na de ji ltar ngas snang ba la mthong ba yin pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid mun par reg go zhes bya ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes par 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de dag yul gcig pa ma yin na de ji ltar ngas snang ba la mthong ba yin pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid mun par reg go zhes bya ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes par 'dir 'gyur /
translated: If the objects of those consciousnesses are not the same, then how is it that when one sees a pot in the light, one connects it to the tactile object in the dark, thinking, ‚ÄúThat is the same pot I touched in the dark‚Äù?

original: de lta bas na dam bcas pa 'di rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dam bcas pa 'di rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this thesis is contradicted by inference.

original: de la 'od byed pas smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la 'od byed pas smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The inference stated by BhƒÅviveka is as follows.

original: yul dpyad par gyur pa'i mthong ba dang reg pa'i shes pa dag ni yul gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: yul dpyad par gyur pa'i mthong ba dang reg pa'i shes pa dag ni yul gcig pa yin te /
translated: The seeing and touching consciousnesses that are the object-determinations have the same object,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir autpala sngon po'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde la / bshad pa de dag mthu las yang dag byung //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir autpala sngon po'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o // de la / bshad pa de dag mthu las yang dag byung //
translated: because they are connected, like the consciousness of a blue lotus.üîΩIn response to this, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: These arise from the power of that.

original: de dag ste kha dog dang reg pa tsam du snang ba'i mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi mthun ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ste kha dog dang reg pa tsam du snang ba'i mig dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi mthun ni nus pa ste /
translated: These, the visual and tactile consciousnesses that appear as mere color and touch, have a power, a capacity.

original: de las yang dag par byung ba'i rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid 'di la yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las yang dag par byung ba'i rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid 'di la yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Since they arise from that, the compound ‚Äúhaving the nature of being connected with the conception that arises from that‚Äù is formed.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this shows that the connecting consciousness is not a direct perception,

original: du ma la gcig tu zhen pa nyid kyis 'di 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir dang rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma la gcig tu zhen pa nyid kyis 'di 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir dang rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mistaken, since it is a conception of many as one, and because it is connected with conception.

original: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other valid cognition,

original: shes pa snga mas yongs su bcad pa'i yul nges pa nyid kyis bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa snga mas yongs su bcad pa'i yul nges pa nyid kyis bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object that is determined by the prior cognition is already apprehended, and because it is erroneous.

original: de lta bas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause of rebirth‚Äù is indeterminate.

original: gal te nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du grub par gyur na /
translated: If the cognition of rebirth were established as valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs nges pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs nges pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time the reason would be certain.

original: ji tsam du gzugs la sogs pa dag la thun mong pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs par brda byas te /
analyzed: ji tsam du gzugs la sogs pa dag la thun mong pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs par brda byas te /
translated: But to the extent that the capacity of form, etc. is demonstrated in common, a convention is made in regard to a pot, etc.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mig dang reg pa dag gis nyams su myong ba de dag la dus phyis ji ltar mthong ba'i yul can rjes su mthun pa'i brda @170b byas pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par gcig nyid du zhen pa 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyis
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mig dang reg pa dag gis nyams su myong ba de dag la dus phyis ji ltar mthong ba'i yul can rjes su mthun pa'i brda @170b byas pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par gcig nyid du zhen pa 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyis
translated: Later, the memory consciousness arises from the specific formative force that is the designation of a single object that is consistent with the object that was seen, in dependence on the experience of that object by the eye and by contact, just as it is itself.

original: dran pa'i shes pa 'di skye'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa 'di skye'o //
translated: This is due to the nature of the error of conceptual adherence.

original: 'di ltar de ltar zhen pa de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog snang gi / reg pa'i shes pa la ni kha dog snang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar zhen pa de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog snang gi / reg pa'i shes pa la ni kha dog snang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the appearance of the color blue, etc. is in the memory consciousness, but the appearance of the color in the tactile consciousness is not reasonable.

original: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the color is the object of the visual consciousness.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni slob dpon gyis mig dang reg pa dag gis bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul tha dad pa dmigs pa de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi'i yul can gzhan tha mi dad pa dran pa'i shes pa skye'o zhes bshad pa gang
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni slob dpon gyis mig dang reg pa dag gis bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul tha dad pa dmigs pa de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi'i yul can gzhan tha mi dad pa dran pa'i shes pa skye'o zhes bshad pa gang
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to explain that the master said that the memory consciousness arises from the specific formative force that is the designation of a single object that is consistent with the object that was seen, in dependence on the experience of that object by the eye and by contact, just as it is itself.

original: yin pa de nyid rigs so //
analyzed: yin pa de nyid rigs so //
translated: This is due to the nature of the error of conceptual adherence.
